introduction 
the little river band of the ottawa indians is a federally recognized indian tribe located in the county of 
manistee in the state of michigan.  they are 120 miles from grand rapids and 90 miles from traverse 
city.   because of the distance to major cities, the tribe is required to be self-sufficient.  the tribe 
supports a government as well as tribal support departments. lrgc is a certified 8(a) and hubzone. 
 
integrity, excellence, & honesty 
founded in 2018, little river government contracting brings the rich history of the little river 
band of ottawa indians to the federal contracting world, based on conducting business with 
uncompromising principles, integrity, excellence, honesty, and dedication that develops and 
maintains enduring relations with our customers and partners. we believe in one team one 
mission � we look forward to serving you! 
 
little river government contracting offers a wide array of core competencies including:

experience 
lrgc has full-service capabilities in all competencies including: 
 
� 
facilities management 
covering start-up operations; personnel and subcontract management; equipment commissioning and 
decommissioning; customer liaison; budget and financial control; etc.  
� 
operations & maintenance services 
involving systems, equipment, and trades like hvac, plumbing, electrical, emcs/bas, environmental control, 
carpentry, painting, maintenance/repairs, planning and scheduling, generators, ups and 
chillers/boilers/bigfoot (customer ticketing and equipment tracking web based software). 
� 
site support services 
including tasks such as janitorial/custodial services; trash and recycling pick-up and removal; service call 
desk operations; elevator maintenance; repairs to buildings and structures; document/media shredding; and 
cleanroom cleaning. 
� 
fire protection services 
we provide testing, construction and installation to of fire protection systems to include automatic 
sprinklers, fire alarms, detections and communication, mass notification and special hazards systems, as well 
as architectural life safety and building code consulting. other services provided include fire protection 
engineering & design and design/build/system installation. 
� 
construction 
we offer design/build/life safety upgrades and construction/office fit out/test facility mock-ups 
� 
security and patrol services 
we provide armed and unarmed law enforcement capability.  we provide security solutions across your 
enterprise, from protecting people and property, controlling traffic, patrolling, responding to calls, writing 
citations, delivering warrants, arresting violators and submitting incident reports. we can also provide 
educational outreach to help prevent and solve crime. 
� 
information technology 
we are a technology enabler and provides a one stop shop for all it needs.  providing training, consulting, 
software and hardware development, and it staffing services on an as-needed basis. our proven 
methodologies and experience with best practices ensure rapid, successful development and deployment of 
your it solutions across your enterprise.

� 
seventh dimension: medical training and support services 
� 
ames1: design/build and design-bid-build construction, environmental abatement, operations and 
maintenance, disaster response & recovery, sustainment, renovation and modernization.

agile team coaching - scrum master ceremonies & building 
functional agile teams 
leading multiple teams - project modeling, machine learning, 
artificial intelligence & automation 
datacenter migrations, virtualization & large-scale database 
migrations 
hybrid cloud deployment & cloud application development
▪ assisted in refining machine learning algorithms, improving data 
accuracy, and automated legacy data collection systems with 
transaction & information bots. 
we have more than 20 years of it project management experience, 10 + 
years of virtualization and cloud application experience, and 8+ years of 
agile scrum master and agile scrum team coaching experience. 
lscs is a mature agile scrum & agile scrum master coaching facility. we have 
successfully completed projects ranging from total datacenter migrations, 
datacenter virtualizations, and application migrations to the cloud to 
automation of applications with machine learning and artificial intelligence 
components. 
▪ lead teams in migrating huntington national bank’s customer master 
database system and enterprise data warehouse to the snowflake cloud. 
- process included creating celestial data lake services. 
▪ lead teams with data scientists in automating jpmorgan chase & co 
 
enterprise real-time server health applications to the cloud. the processes 
included machine learning & artificial intelligence components. 
▪ experience training new scrum masters, coaching product owners, 
and scrum teams.
▪taken dysfunctional scrum teams and trained them to be highly 
functional, productive, and valuable teams. 
virtualization experience - datacenter, cloud & virtual container 
artificial intelligence experience - machine learning, python predictive 
modeling & robotics

8(a) certified tribal enterprise
makwa global logistics, a subsidiary of makwa global, was formed to offer government agencies a new approach to 
tribal enterprise capabilities. makwa global, llc is a tribal enterprise (te) owned by the mille lacs band of ojibwe, a 
business-savvy tribe with over 30 companies and 5,000 employees throughout the world. makwa companies are sba 
8(a) certified and have a diverse set of capabilities, experience, and history.
makwa global logistics was designed to enhance efficiency, provide supply chain visibility, real-time performance, 
and a full suite of tools to accelerate productivity.  for over 26 years our team has managed the full life-cycle 
logistics process for companies spanning the globe, providing solutions for a full array of services including supply 
chain management, warehousing, project management, fulfillment, dispatch services, food service management, and 
customized solutions.

makwa global professional services, a subsidiary of makwa global, was formed to offer government agencies a new 
approach to tribal enterprise capabilities. makwa global, llc is a tribal enterprise (te) owned by the mille lacs band of 
ojibwe, a business-savvy tribe with over 30 companies and 5,000 employees throughout the world. makwa companies 
are sba 8(a) certified and have a diverse set of capabilities, experience, and history ranging from administrative staffing, 
it solutions, advisory/consulting services, logistic services, travel services, static security, crisis management, and 
training to military, law enforcement, government, and commercial entities.  
makwa global professional services is a mission-focused company that offers tailored services by providing highly 
qualified and experienced administrative and program support services personnel to enable our client’s mission success. 
in addition, our strategic partnerships offer experienced leadership and technological experts capable of rapid and 
reliable delivery of it cloud-based services.
makwa global professional services provides mission-focused 
administrative staffing, professional, scientific, and technical services to 
enable and ensure our client’s mission success.

makwa global (pronounced: ‘mahk-wah”) is a tribal enterprise, led by a proud member of the tribal community.  makwa is a portfolio of small 
businesses and sba 8(a) certified companies mille lacs band of ojibwe. nestled on the edges of mille lacs lake in east central minnesota, the mille 
lacs band of ojibwe has called this region home since 1745. although most of the reservation land granted to them by the u.s. government was taken 
away, they have maintained their history and traditions. determined, proud, and resourceful as a people, they have preserved their rich culture for hun-
dreds of years. through the mille lacs band of ojibwe, mille lacs corporate ventures now owns over 30 businesses worldwide, employs nearly 5,000 
people, and is the 40th largest employer in minnesota. makwa is proud to represent the mille lacs band of ojibwe.

Ruspini Management Solutions is a certified SBA 8(a) (Expires 09/2030), HUBZone certified, Economically Disadvantaged Women Owned Small Business (WOSB)/(EDWOSB) that possesses the skills and capabilities necessary to perform the stated requirements. Ruspini Management Solutions’ scope of services include administration, consulting, facilities maintenance, acquisitions, asset management, property maintenance, city compliance, property preservation, property management, managing and marketing competencies. Ruspini Management Solutions has 3 employees, 6 independent contractors and has been in business since 2005.

CORE COMPETENCIES
We help clients maintain control, reduce risk, coordinate logistics, manage communication, and enhance readiness for critical initiatives by using our proven processes, a network of professionals, and partnerships to deliver results. We provide services in, but are not limited to, the following areas:
• Acquisition Support
• System Implementation
• Program Management
• Audit/Compliance
• Project Management
• Information Security
WHY 7TH ECHELON
FLEXIBILITY: We maintain effectiveness during major changes in our client’s environments. We understand the importance of addressing the needs of numerous stakeholders and constituencies during uncertainty.
QUALITY: We deliver effective, practical solutions to complex problems and provide accurate, transparent reporting at the appropriate level of discretion.
COURAGE: We never compromise on ethics, quality, or professional standards.

IT and Managed Services
GEORGE STREET provides certified personnel providing optimization, proactive, reactive and real-time support and management for Windows, Linux and Solaris servers and systems to include efficient, flexible and cost-effective solutions to ensure reliability and performance; network and database administration; virtualization; help-desk services and tier 1-3 problem identification, diagnosis and resolution; information assurance, cybersecurity and other services.
Management Services
GEORGE STREET provides Agile IT management; strategic management; PMO services; business process management; and portfolio, program & project management support. Our services are powered by strategy, project planning and execution that is actionable and time bound, uniting clients and teams for effective and efficient collaboration.
Software Engineering
Our software experts use scaled, agile practices and DevSecOps pipelines to accelerate and automate platforms and application delivery using open, cloud-native, and portable architectures. Our approach supports digital environments that are user-centric, modular and scalable. GEORGE STREET software engineering includes web development, micro-services, big data solutions, cloud analytics, and Internet of Things.
Cybersecurity Services and Solutions
GEORGE STREET protects systems and data by offering a full complement of services, including: penetration testing; system exploitation prevention; network hardening expertise; network vulnerabilities identification and documentation; computer network defense; information assurance; virtual/physical network design; comprehensive security architecture installation and implementation; risk assessment and analytics evaluations.

Accent Designs LLC has been a federal government partner for more than 25 years providing custom window treatment systems designed to maximize control of natural sunlight while minimizing reliance on artificial lighting in commercial office applications. We provide an integrated package of distinctive custom window treatment solutions to include:
• Manual and motorized horizontal blinds
• Manual and motorized solar and blackout shading systems
• Manual and motorized curtain and drapery systems
• Custom top treatments and valances
• Electrical wiring services for motorized systems
• Solar, blast & eavesdropping mitigation window films
As a GSA Schedule Contract holder, we are committed to delivering quality Made-in-the-USA window treatment solutions, on-time and within budget, thereby helping our customers avoid change orders or modifications and eliminate additional unplanned, undesirable expenses.
We engage only trained and certified local installers who maintain a commitment to integrity, dedication, and professionalism to ensure a well-planned and executed installation to keep your daily office operations running smoothly.

executive summary 
marathon life sciences (marathon ls) is a team of manufacturer-trained service engineers who 
utilize 85+ years of maintenance, repairs, and calibration of laboratory equipment experience.  
our main goal is long-term equipment efficiency.  we also stock laboratory consumables, which 
offers a stable supply chain and allows us to deliver an unparalleled experience for clients. 
our team relies on thorough communication and clearly set expectations to deliver exemplary 
customer service. we understand that delays resulting from sourcing difficulties can have large 
impacts on productivity, especially when it comes to the students or employees relying on 
necessary laboratory supplies. we want to ensure that you lose as little time as possible to 
maintain efficiency. 
laboratory supplies 
marathon ls’ lab supplies line includes dishes, flasks, strainers and 
filtration products, tubes, plates and reservoirs, pipets and pipette 
tips, and pcr strips and tubes. we frequently update the products 
we offer and are committed to improvement by customer-driven 
feedback.  if you need a laboratory product we do not currently 
provide, our customer service experts will help you find what you 
are looking for. 
because we produce our own branded products, we have 
extensive knowledge regarding lab supplies and can provide 
high quality materials without the need for a middleman.  all 
products we offer, we have immediate access to. this results in 
speedier delivery times to get clients the supplies they need.  
we understand that efficiency and quality are both equally 
important for success, and the ability to source in-demand, 
sometimes hard to obtain products sets us apart. 
as a smaller company, marathon ls is more in control of the supplies we provide our 
customers. we have a strong focus on customer service, quick response times, and you’ll be 
working with the same dedicated team of individuals every time.  we’ve also begun the process 
to providing laboratory supplies that are solely manufactured in the united states.

ohlinger studios is an sba wosb certified (woman-owned) business based in columbus, 
ohio. ohlinger studios partners with training organizations to design, develop, and deliver 
innovative learning experiences that deeply engage all learners and increase student 
achievement. since 1995, ohlinger studios has successfully worked with our clients to 
develop over 400 complete training/educational programs across across a broad spectrum 
of critical career development topics. we have substantial experience with some of the 
largest learning content providers, effectively executing large-scale program management. 
our smaller size allows us to be flexible, act quickly, control quality, reduce costs, and most 
importantly, help our clients meet the ever-changing demands of delivering educational 
and training content.

of individuals across your training spectrum. our team 
takes pride in effectively executing on any size project,

relationships necessary to deliver a successful project

• our processes we bring order to complex projects 
by defining the needed processes to keep large-scale 
training programs on track. these defined processes 
give give us the ability to navigate large-scale projects, 
work independently, with minimal client oversight 
needed.
• our business model we are intentionally smaller 
in size so that we can continue to be flexible and agile 
to adapt to any changes in the marketplace. through 
our defined processes, we are able to quickly scale by 
leveraging our large and vetted network of experienced 
and trusted subject-matter experts, freelancers 
and vendors to bring additional capacity, skill and 
knowledge to any project. this allows us to keep costs 
low while also meeting any growing demands.
• our experience our team has deep and expansive 
experience in developing learning designs and working 
across multiple learning platforms. we understand how 
to best leverage technology to enhance learning, rather 
than just to deliver content online.

business process improvement capability statement
business development associates llc (bda global) is a 
management consulting firm that specializes in the provision 
of business resilience and operational improvement services. 
we have been in business since 2002, with over 150 
clients served, the vast majority as the prime contractor. our 
clients include a broad range of governmental, private 
sector, and non-profit organizations.
bda global’s operational resilience services are targeted to 
aiding government agencies efforts to business operations 
and we provide process mapping, review, and 
reengineering services. this includes lean six sigma 
studies, as-is process mapping, benchmarking and process 
improvement studies, business process redesign, customer 
service improvement, and the development of standard 
operating procedures.
bda global’s leadership team includes highly experienced 
executives and managers with significant public service and 
public sector consulting experience.

capability statement: 
psapling manufactures and professionally installs patent-pending multi-use solar structures that serve as shelter, shade, resting 
spots, & outdoor meeting places for the yard, premises, campus, parking lot, field, park, base, or other area while generating 
clean, zero-emissions solar energy to power and decarbonize adjacent buildings, homes, & facilities.  our weekly manufacturing 
capacity is presently 500 psapling units – annualized to clean power generation of 65,000 megawatt-hr and 
reduction/avoidance of greenhouse gases by 27,000 tons – and we can deliver and install units nationally and overseas.   
  differentiators: 
• 
introduced multi-use solar structures to the industry (patent-pending) 
•     multi-use solar structures provide the best overall financial value and return on investment 
•     psapling’s multi-use solar structures efficiently utilize scarce physical space, and add value to that space 
•     structures generate clean solar power and are aesthetically tasteful 
•     grid-tie or off-grid compatible, with minimal to no maintenance needed

mmatthias@desmoineswa.gov); montana state university – northern (greg kegel, chancellor, chancellor@msun.edu); enell inc.

scheduled follow-on presentations – in each case, strong interest.  we have 15 additional organizational requests to present 
psapling in q1 2022.  due to institutional/residential demand, psapling now has regional reps in the se, sw, and west coast.  in 
addition, psapling principals have a combined 35 years of world-class zero-emissions and low-carbon energy systems experience.

renewable energy design concepts llc. ~ cage code 6wws2~ 389 collins rd toledo, wa 98591 ~ kfetters@redcenergy.com ~ (360)219-8934 
capabilities statement 
redc invents and manufactures clean energy technologies that help 
solve some of the world’s most pressing issues today. our technologies 
serve the needs of those in developed and developing nations. we tackle 
difficult problems, such as; climate change, malnutrition, food security, 
irrigation, rural electrification and clean water. 
naics codes: 22111, 335220, subsector 335 
 
redc’s hydrokinetic prime mover: converts the hydrokinetic energy from flowing water into mechanical energy with 
little to if any impact on the environment. the mechanical energy is used to pump water uphill for energy storage and irrigation. 
water current is deflected by the fender into buckets and away from the returning collapsed buckets. the buckets pull a chain 
around sprockets, which turn a set of gears and a shaft. the shaft is connected to a centrifugal pump for uphill water pumping.  
rural communities that are located close to flowing rivers and mountains now have the ability to create reliable, carbon-free energy 
24 hours a day with our hydrokinetic pumped energy storage system. dams become more efficient by recouping waste energy for 
reuse. small-scale farmers in developing nations now have the ability to irrigate 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. 
redc’s solar food preservation facility: (sfpf) preserves nutritious foods long-term for small-scale farmers in 
developing nations without needing access to electricity. the sfpf comes equipped with a walk-in cooler for short-term storage of 
nutritious foods. the glass jar canning room helps farmers create new products for their businesses. the preserved, fresh food 
provides community members with low-cost, nutritious food year round. pregnant and nursing mothers can now provide their 
children with the proper micronutrients a growing body requires.

cyber security capability statement  
rivera group has been providing cyber security services within the federal government since 2004.  
our two cyber security products, eagle6 and secure office, focus on protecting enterprise assets 
on a network, and unauthorized access to classified information contained in documents.  we also 
offer professional services to accompany the software products as our company has a top secret 
facility clearance and ts-sci cleared personnel.  this capabilities statement provides a brief 
description of the software and professional services we have to offer our customers.

products and services 
 
eagle6 imports differing types of enterprise 
data (network logs, source code, config files, 
database schemas, etc.) and builds a model 
of the enterprise, its actors, and how entities in 
the enterprise collect and share data.  using 
ml and ai, eagle6 is capable of identifying 
anomalous behavior that may indicate cyber activity and generates automated dashboards and 
reports that identify the impact of the unwanted behavior to critical mission systems. 
 
secure office (2021 beta release) is a 
document management cyber security product 
that focuses on protecting classified 
information using machine learning, artificial 
intelligence, customizable access controls, 
and in-document need-to-know (n2k) 
security.  the tool has editors for documents, 
spreadsheets, and presentations, and also includes a whiteboard editor.  all tools utilize our 
secure drive document repository that is specifically designed for access control integration.

advanced reading concepts was founded in 1977 in columbus, 
ohio. over the past 40 years we have taught over 12,000 people to read 
faster and to understand more.  engineers, scientists, analysts and other 
professionals in corporations, government agencies and the military have 
acquired lifelong skills to improve their personal productivity. 
 
company principals: 
bonnie james, president and co-founder and principal instructor is a 
nationally recognized speaker and trainer for conferences, trade 
associations, schools, corporations and government installations.  bonnie 
has received numerous awards for her work with students, professionals 
and the tech community including the small business person of the year 
by the grandview chamber, a distinguished alumni and career 
achievement award by the ohio state university.  
 
bob james is an experienced business professional with experience in 
marketing professional services and automation systems. he has managed 
consulting programs for the small business administration and for usaid 
in india.  he also developed and managed a worldwide distribution network 
for industrial automation products. he has a bs degree in engineering and 
an mba in marketing and business economics. 
 
services:

speedreading plusâ„¢ technical reading and writing courses and reading 
faster to understand moreâ„¢ seminars that include strategies for improving 
comprehension, recall and retention along with speed for all kinds of 
reading materials from general to highly technical. the programs also cover 
techniques for preparing material for reports and presentations. these 
courses are held on-site for government agencies, the military, corporations 
and associations. public classes are held in columbus.

capability statement 
established in 1977, all foam products offers a wide variety of foam and rubber products designed to support all our 
government agencies and a variety of commercial industries, including: military agencies, tactical and non-tactical 
ground vehicles, medical and healthcare, aerospace, automotive, construction and packaging. we are proud of our 
reputation for on-time delivery and superior customer service. by providing design solutions and product alternatives, 
all foam products is aligned to deliver our customersâ€™ specific needs. as a leader in the packaging, kitting and cushioning 
industries, our solutions support a diverse commercial, government and industrial clientele.   
 
 
defense and government markets:  
ground tactical vehicles, aerospace,  
tool inventory control 
featured products 
tool box foam â€“ we offer a variety of polyethylene (pe) material in standard sizes for your own tool box foam 
customization. or, we have extensive fabrication capabilities to customize to your specifications. our offerings allow 
you to create a storage solution that will work for your operationsâ€™ tool inventory control needs. with our years of 
experience and breadth of product options, we support varying degrees of tool control kitting solutions. 
military specification cushioning â€“ we feature a wide-range of polyurethane foams to satisfy patient-care 
applications and packaging needs required in both military and commercial facilities.  
engineering and electronic protective foams â€“ our products include a full variety of polyurethane, polyethylene and 
rubber products that offer cushioning and protection for fragile and sensitive military, medical or packaging supplies. 
we provide anti-static and conductive foams that are especially effective in protecting electronic equipment from 
static electrical damage. 
ballistic foam â€“ in partnership with vertex aerospace, we offer ballistic foam used in military aircraft to prevent 
hazards and protect government aircrafts according to military required specifications.  
fabrication specialties â€“ we offer extensive capabilities, including:  bonding, contour cutting, cnc technology, die 
cutting, waterjet, hot wire cutting, laminating and pressure sensitive adhesive services.

stator rewound with our patented pst 
technology  
 
the technology 
in brief, simple terms, our technology 
captures unused power and sends it 
directly back to the motor winding. this 
reduces the amount of electricity that 
the motor will need from the power grid, 
while still operating at the same hp, 
rpm, and torque as a regular motor.  
 
about us: 
the company 
our vision is to revolutionize the field of 
electrical engineering by using our patented 
technology to provide efficiency, cost 
savings, and increased capabilities to our 
customers as well as increased options for 
the nationâ€™s electric grid. we are a service 
disabled veteran owned business.  
what we do 
our patented technology is the industry 
leader in electric motor energy savings. at 
condor, we take a customerâ€™s existing motor 
(1hp-300hp) and rewind it using our 
patented phase shift transformer (pst) 
technology.

7727

website: condorglobaltechnology.com

what our technology

the benefits:

from the main lines

meter and electric bill 
 
 
 
services: 
condor offers an energy analysis that 
can be done at your location, so that 
we can better determine your current 
energy consumption and how our 
technology can benefit you.  
commercial 
we offer rewinds with the pst 
technology in a wide range of pumps, 
vertical well pumps, and other types of 
centrifugal pumps. as well as other 
types of ac induction motors. 
industrial 
our pst technology can also be used in a 
variety of industrial and manufacturing 
motors as well. some examples include: 
rock crushers, vacuum pumps, 
conveyor belt motors, industrial fans, 
freezer-air handlers, exhaust fan 
motors, in line booster pumps, mixer 
motors, gear box motors, mining, and 
hydraulic pump motors.   
we replace factory shielded bearings 
with sealed bearings for longer bearing 
life. all rewinds with pst technology 
include dipping in modified polyester 
varnish. all motors 75 hp and over are 
double dipped and double baked.  
warranty: 
rebuilds with pst technology 
unlike other companies that offer 6 
months up to 1 year, we at condor give a 
full 3-year warranty on all pst rewinds, 
which includes full cleaning and 
inspection of all parts, rewind with pst 
technology as well as 50, 000 hour 
sealed bearings. also at no additional 
charge, you will receive quarterly 
checkups for the full length of your 
warranty period to ensure proper motor 
operation. a report will be emailed to 
you after each checkup.  
warranty covers all parts, material, and 
labor on motor. 
new motors with pst technology 
we at condor give a full 5-year warranty 
on all pst rewinds on new motors (as 
purchased through condor) as well as 
installing 50,000 hour sealed bearings. 
also at no additional charge, you will

mission 
 
to deliver quality construction services with quality products with an eye on the future. 
 
philosophy 
 
discount roof inc. develops relationships with its clients to identify their needs and to provide quality 
solutions and technical  resources that meet their needs, while advancing technology in the construction 
field.  fast reliable services backed by unprecented warranties.   
 
why discount roof inc. 
• 
outstanding workmanship.  we strive for less than 1% call back rate in an industry where 28 % is 
acceptable. 
• 
lifetime workmanship warranty. 
• 
competitive pricing. 
• 
over 31 years in the industry, currently 2nd and 3rd generation. 
• 
unmatched product knowledge, constantly training and expanding our knowledge on products 
of the future. 
• 
gaf master elite contractor 
• 
involved in over 9000 successful projects. 
• 
licensed bonded and insured in over 40 municipalities in indiana 
 
performance history 
• 
2 consecutive years of 100% growth.

a+ bbb rating 
 
company background 
discount roof inc. was founded by douglas judy in 2019, and is quickly becoming one of the fastest 
growing construction companies in indiana.  douglas has been in the industry since 1991 in various 
duties related to construction and roofing, from distribution, manufacturing, to sub-contracting, and has 
always been one of the top performers in the country, winning many honors.  when it was time to start 
discount roof inc. manufacturers, employees, and distributors lined up to partner with him, knowing he 
would never rest in a difficult landscape while trying to succeed.  always keeping his eye on the future, 
expanding product lines is important to him, especially when it comes to technology.

dear ms forus:
congratulations! your firm has been certified as a participant in the u.s. small
business administration's (sba) 8(a) business development program. your nine
(9) year program term begins on the date of this letter.
during participation in the 8(a) business development program, you will receive
business development assistance from an assigned business development
specialist in the richmond district office, 400 north 8th street, suite 1150,
richmond, va 23240. the phone number is (804) 771- 2400. we are sending a
copy of this certification letter to the sba richmond district office. that office will
contact you to schedule an orientation session. this could take up to 4-6 weeks.
in the meantime, there are steps you should take to start your participation in the
program.
next steps
• read and sign participation agreement: sba requires the 8(a) participant’s
president or chief executive officer sign a participation agreement showing he
or she understands the conditions of 8(a) bd program participation. please find
the agreement attached to the approval email associated with this letter. please
read the agreement carefully, sign and date it, and make a copy. return one
copy to the sba richmond district office at the address shown in the second
paragraph above. the second copy is for your records.
• develop your business plan: we encourage you to start developing your
business plan. current 8(a) bd program regulations require a firm, once certified,
to promptly submit a business plan which must be approved by the sba before
the firm is eligible to receive 8(a) benefits; including 8(a) contracts. once
approved, the business plan will be reviewed annually and may be modified as
needed. we offer an optional format for business plans. to consider the optional
8(a) business plan form 1010c, please go to: https://www.sba.gov/sites/default/
files/sba%201010c.pdf.
• develop your strategy for winning contracts in year 1: though your firm’s
approved north american industry classification system (naics) code is
561621, your firm may be awarded contracts under other naics codes, as long
as your firm is qualified to perform the required service or task. in this regard,
please note that contracts awarded under 8(a) business development program
authority generally result from the self-marketing efforts of participating firms.
you must build relationships with potential federal customers, pursue federal
prime contractors for subcontracts, and aggressively pursue prime contract
opportunities to grow your business. successful 8(a) firms regularly respond to
competitive small business contracting opportunities posted on www.fbo.gov.
establish a goal and vision for winning at least two (2) competitive contracts
during your first year.
• utilize resources: there are valuable free resources available to you right
now that offer expertise in all areas of business operation including reviewing
your business plan and strategy. two resources that you can utilize today are:
o sba resource partners: i encourage you to locate your nearest resource
partner, please go to: https://www.sba.gov/tools/local-assistance. this link will
provide access to upcoming small business events and the webpage for your
district sba office, also.
o 7(j) management and technical assistance: while your firm’s acceptance into
the 8(a) business development program is not a guarantee for contracts, the
sba will make every effort to assist you in implementing your business plan and
strategy. your success in the program is dependent upon the extent to which you
take advantage of sba’s efforts to support you. one of the agency’s major tools
for your success is the 7(j) management and technical assistance services
program. for more information, click on the following link: https://www.sba.gov/
about-sba/sba-initiatives/7j-management-and-technical-assistance-services-
program
i am excited about your future, and i welcome you as an 8(a) business
development program participant. wishing you much success!
sincerely,
jackie robinson-burnette
associate administrator
office of business development
u.s. small business administration
washington, dc 20416

dear steven forus:
congratulations! . . . welcome to the hubzone program!
i am pleased to advise you that effective this date, diverse solutions group inc. has been approved for certification as a "qualified hubzone small business concern (sbc)".
the firm is now eligible for hubzone opportunities and will be included on the list of qualified hubzone small business concerns found at
http://dsbs.sba.gov/dsbs/search/dsp_searchhubzone.cfm. this certification will remain in effect unless sba later determines that the firm does not meet the eligibility
requirements of the program or the firm submits a voluntary decertification form. the information below sets forth facts concerning the company's continued eligibility and its
responsibilities. 
the firm's responsibilities as a hubzone certified concern
as a hubzone certified concern, the program benefits the firm may receive come with important responsibilities, including:
keeping the firm's system for award management (sam) and dynamic small business search (dsbs) records up-to-date. to apply for hubzone program
certification, the firm had to be registered in sam and dsbs. for the firm to receive benefits from the hubzone program (i.e., to be identified by contracting officers as
eligible to receive hubzone contracts and to be paid under any such contracts), these records must remain up-to-date. you must validate the firm's information at
least annually or your sam registration will become inactive. if you need assistance in updating the firm's sam or dsbs information, please go to the sam help desk
at https://fsd.gov/fsd-gov/home.do.
informing the hubzone program of any material changes to the concern. if there are material changes to the concern that may affect its continued eligibility, you
must notify the hubzone program by sending an e-mail to hzmcn@sba.gov. material changes include a change in name, size, ownership, business structure, or
principal office location, in addition to falling below the 35% employee hubzone residency requirement when the firm is not performing on a hubzone contract.
failure to notify the hubzone program of material changes may result in decertification from the program. if at any time the concern no longer qualifies for the
hubzone program, the individual authorized to represent the firm can complete the "voluntary decertification agreement" available at
http://www.sba.gov/content/maintaining-hubzone-certification.
note: the hubzone program sends notices regarding program examinations, proposed decertifications, and re-certifications to the firm's physical and email
addresses of record. if the firm fails to respond to these notices because the firm relocated without updating its sam and dsbs profiles and informing the hubzone
program, sba will propose the firm for decertification and may subsequently decertify it from the program. therefore, it is critical that you check your email's spam
folder to make sure that you are receiving emails from sba, notify us of any change in the physical address and keep the firm's sam and dsbs profiles current.
remaining in compliance at all times and staying updated on program changes. it is the firm's responsibility to continually ensure that it meets the requirements
of the program. this includes, for example, continuously meeting the 35% hubzone residency requirement. the firm can make good faith efforts to "attempt to
maintain" (see definition at 13 c.f.r. § 126.103) having 35% of its employees reside in a hubzone during the performance of a hubzone contract it received (as a
prime, not as a subcontractor). but, the business must meet this residency requirement anytime it submits an offer on and receives a new hubzone contract. this also
includes complying with contract performance requirements in connection with any hubzone contracts awarded to the firm as a qualified hubzone sbc (e.g., the
subcontracting limitations requirements set forth in 13 c.f.r. § 126.700, and/or the non-manufacturer rule set forth in 13 c.f.r. § 126.601(e)).
periodically visiting our website (http://www.sba.gov/hubzone) to keep up-to-date with the program requirements and geographical designations. check
sba's hubzone mapping pages to determine whether changes in hubzone area designations impact or will impact the firm's eligibility at
http://www.sba.gov/content/hubzone-maps. while there, sign up to receive hubzone news updates via email; and when you need help, go to the small business
learning center at http://www.sba.gov/tools/sba-learning-center.
participating in sba eligibility monitoring initiatives. in order to ensure the integrity of the program, firms will be required to recertify their status and may be
subject to program examinations, proposed decertifications, or protests designed to verify eligibility, including:
sba requiring the concern to certify in writing under penalty of perjury that it continues to meet all the eligibility criteria of the hubzone program or
voluntarily decertify
sba requiring the concern to submit updated documentation, similar to the information and documents you provided for the firm to obtain initial certification,
in order to verify that it remains eligible for the program.
sba requiring the concern to demonstrate that it was eligible for the program both at the time of its initial offer and award of a hubzone contract.
sba making unannounced site visits to any or all of the concern's locations to verify the accuracy of any information provided to sba.
misrepresentation: by bidding on any federal solicitation that is set-aside or reserved only for hubzone sbcs or for which a hubzone preference will be applied,
the firm's submission of that offer is deemed to be a representation to the united states that the company is fully in compliance with the hubzone regulatory
requirements, and that there have been no material changes since it received the hubzone certification. any sbc found to misrepresent its hubzone
status in obtaining such an award may be subject to a range of civil or criminal penalties, treble damages under the false
claims act, and/or suspension or debarment from federal contracting.
how to get the most out of the program
although the firm's status as a certified hubzone sbc greatly improves its access to federal awards, this certification does not guarantee contract awards. your
ability to research opportunities and competitively bid on them will be the key to your success in this program. i recommend you utilize the following additional web
resources designed to help you maximize the program's benefits:
sba's government contracting classroom website at (http://www.sba.gov/gcclassroom) provides valuable information on federal contracting. please note
that while your concern was approved under the primary north american industry classification system (naics) code found in your firm's sam and dsbs
profiles, you may be awarded contracts under other naics codes. you may benefit from researching and identifying potential hubzone contracting
opportunities outside your profile's naics code.
sba's surety bond program website (www.sba.gov/osg) provides information on how to apply for an sba surety bond guarantee.
federal business opportunities (www.fbo.gov) serves as a central listing for federal procurement solicitations to the public.
thank you for contributing to us economic development
we wish you the best of luck as a hubzone certified concern - your success will help improve the economic future of the hubzone(s) in which the firm operates. if at
any time you have any questions about the program or how the sba may be able to support your business objectives, the hubzone office offers assistance via an
interactive conference call where we can respond to general questions and concerns in real-time. visit our website at http://www.sba.gov/hubzone, for additional
information or contact the hubzone help desk at hubzone@sba.gov 
sincerely, 
mariana pardo 
director
office of hubzone program

on behalf of the u.s. department of veterans affairs (va), center for verification 
and evaluation (cve), i am writing to inform you that your application for reverification 
has been approved. diverse solutions group inc. will remain eligible to participate in 
veterans first contracting program opportunities with va as a verified service-disabled 
veteran-owned small business (sdvosb).
this verification is valid for three (3) years from the date of this letter. 
please retain a copy of this letter to confirm diverse solutions group inc.'s continued 
program eligibility in accordance with 38 code of federal regulation (cfr) § 74.12. 
you may reapply 120 days prior to your new expiration date by logging into 
https://www.vip.vetbiz.gov/.
to promote diverse solutions group inc.'s verified status, you may use the 
following link to download the logo for use on your marketing materials and business 
cards: https://www.va.gov/osdbu/docs/cve_completed_s.jpg. in addition, please 
access the following link for information on next steps and opportunities for verified 
businesses:
http://www.va.gov/osdbu/verification/whatsnext.asp.
while cve has confirmed that diverse solutions group inc. is presently, as of 
the issuance of this notice, in compliance with the regulation, diverse solutions group 
inc. must inform cve of any changes or other circumstances that would adversely 
affect its eligibility. eligibility changes not reported to cve within 30 days could result in 
a referral to the office of inspector general (oig), a referral to the debarment and 
suspension committee, and the initiation of cancellation proceedings—all of which 
could result in diverse solutions group inc. being removed from the vip verification 
program.

background
●
despite deployment of numerous security tools, organizations continue to be exploited through
vulnerable devices and services costing tens of millions of dollars per company per incident.
●
sixmap internet-wide assessments show organizations continue to expose vulnerabilities on ipv4
●
existing internet-wide capabilities scan just 3% of the ipv4 tcp attack surface (~2k ipv4 tcp ports)
●
ipv4 network services running on non-standard ports are more likely to be insecure
●
ipv6 adoption increased 34,000% over the last decade but traditional solutions cannot scan ipv6
●
every company that deploys ipv6 inherently increases their exposure risk:
○
stateless address autoconfiguration (slaac) enables devices to self-assign ipv6 addresses
○
network address translation (nat) does not protect devices on ipv6, allowing global access
○
firewalls and network intrusion detection systems are not adequately deployed on ipv6
sixmap
sixmap monitors 50x more of the network than traditional solutions and provides concise actionable
intelligence to reduce network security risk. sixmap is the only organization mapping ipv6 network-wide
and scans all 65,535 tcp ports on ipv4 and ipv6. sixmap also analyzes and prioritizes scan results so
defenders can triage problems and maximize risk reduction per man hour (e.g., sort cves by cvss or
subnets by attack surface and risk). analysts use sixmap’s platform to assess enterprise networks in
minutes and historical data enables security teams to verify risk reduction. sixmap uses adaptive
empirical analysis (aea) to iteratively interact with networks to discover devices, ports, and services.
●
achieve 50x more attack surface coverage
●
defend >99% (vs 3%) of the network
●
automatically triage vulnerabilities
●
maximize risk reduction per man hour
●
address acute and pervasive ipv4 problems
●
track progress with historical graphs
●
prepare and transition to ipv6 with confidence
●
automatically detect ipv6 misconfiguration
global coverage
sixmap continuously maps the entire internet to identify and scan the customer’s devices and services
even if they are connected via a cloud provider (e.g., aws), shared network, or another organization.
services
sixmap scans the customer’s network remotely from sixmap’s asns and servers or with our fully
contained on-site hardware. the customer interacts with sixmap scan results and vulnerability analysis
via our rest api and sixmap web platform.
how our customers have used sixmap over the last six months:
our customers use sixmap to harden the most secure networks on the planet. here are some examples of
how our customers have used sixmap over the last six months:
●
remediated “critically” vulnerable network services on “random” ipv4 ports
●
removed unexpected services running on routers and guest networks
●
reconfigured globally reachable subnets that should be local access only
●
blocked ipv6-only services (services exposed on ipv6 but not ipv4)
●
tracked ipv6 deployment progress
●
vulnerable vm hosted on customer’s external cloud provider’s network
contact: austin murdock, phd, austin@sixmap.io, 410-417-7566, sixmap.io

capability overview 
 
ovana global logistics (sgl) is a woman owned, small 
business and certified hubzone specializing in global freight 
forwarding with an established client base spanning 
government, corporate and commercial sectors. conveniently 
located just outside of washington dulles airport, sovana global 
logistics has a fully operational facility offering 10,000 + square 
foot of warehouse space to efficiently and effectively receive, store 
and prepare for transit inventory as required by our clients, with 
expansion capabilities to quickly manage sudden surges in 
workload in dubai uae, and many countries on african continent.  
about us 
sovana global logistics’ employees hail from a variety of 
backgrounds within the transportation and service industries 
delivering our clients a deep understanding and exceptional 
customer service to meet their multifaceted and often unique 
demands. all operations employees are experienced and have 
been formally trained to store and handle a variety of sensitive 
commodities to include dangerous goods / hazmat as well as 
export controlled goods (i.e. arms and ammo, ppe, etc). our core 
competencies span the entire domain of the freight forwarding 
industry. since we opened our doors in 2010, sgl has developed a 
proven record of past performance and experience. as a result, our 
accomplishments provide a foundation of excellence, assuring a 
successfully managed shipment, each and every time.   
corporate strategy 
as the global transportation community continues to grow and 
evolve, sgl recognizes and adapts to the ever constant “market 
shifts”; modifying and customizing service offerings and 
capabilities to meet our customers’ demands, offering the 
scalability, flexibility and resources that most competitors cannot.  
our business model allows for the full integration of our client’s 
needs rapidly into our daily operations with little to no service 
interruption. a sound infrastructure, financial backing and 
relationships with agencies with a strong presence within their 
respective nations allow sovana global logistics to fulfill all levels 
of service.

moveone, inc. 
our partner moveone inc represents an entire network of agents that has provided international logistics, 
relocations and moving services for 25 years worldwide. moveone has provided support to countless us 
government contracts covering military, humanitarian aid, and energy sectors. with operations in eastern 
europe, the balkans, central asia, the middle east and the african region, moveone is an excellent partner 
with the resources as well as exceptional past performance to satisfy all in country requirements for those 
task orders set in the regions they serve.   
to satisfy the requirements of the contracts we support originating in the uae, sgl has partnered with 
moveone, a professional international freight forwarding firm, to ensure all levels of service are met. as an 
extension of sgl, moveone would provide the following services –  
 
ø export packing and crating – moveone specializes in custom packing and crating solutions to fit 
fluor’s unique cargo needs and prepare for shipping. 
ø containerizing – moveone specializes in the preparation of containers for ocean, rail, and highway 
transportation. moveone handles hundreds of containers per month, including standard, flat-racks and 
open-top, utilizing load plan programs. additionally, they have expertise in designing creative solutions 
for securing your cargo specific to the mode of shipping. 
ø freight consolidation, warehousing and project management – moveone is fully conversant with 
receiving, packing, inventory management and international freight forwarding activities, currently 
providing a similar service supporting logcap iv. their understanding of the process from contingent 
receipt to acceptance is up to date, as is their familiarity with the various management reports 
associated with receiving and packing activities e.g. daily receiving, os&d, mrr, on-hand and out-
bound reports. this ensures that they are eminently qualified and competent to handle and track the 
progress of project material through staging facilities and readiness to mobilize assets for material 
dispatches as and when requested 
ø warehouse and storage - all freight not requiring immediate shipping is stored at moveone’s facility. 
indoor storage is provided for materials requiring covered-space or outside if not required.  designated 
storage area for fluor will be provided as requested / required. 
ø imr receiving - before fluor’s cargo is received in the warehouse a physical and visible check of all 
pieces (e.g., cartons, bundles, skids, etc.) is made to ensure the material was not received damaged. all 
pieces are then physically opened for inspection. once material is received, all freight is weighed and 
located into proper location and is entered into moveone’s wms where the interim material receipt is 
created.  all pieces are then assigned a unique tracking number on the outside of the package for 
immediate identification and warehouse location.   
ø inventory inspections - all material received shall be subject to a three level inventory match against; 
the vendor’s packing list, the part numbers and other information given on the material itself, and the 
itemized po. during inspection moveone shall ensure that there is a complete match in all of the 
above. all boxes or containers shall be opened and a physical count/inspection made of every piece to 
confirm full conformity with what was actually ordered per the specifications identified within the po. 
verified items shall be marked off on the packing list as received. 
ø equipment – moveone is fully outfitted with lifting, pulling, hoisting equipment to appropriately 
handle cargo well over 10,000 lbs. all warehouse staff are fully trained and experienced on the proper 
use of this equipment. any special equipment required for oversized / heavy cargo can be leased and / 
or rented quickly, to ensure no interruption in loading and or off-loading procedures.

kuwait – sovana agent: gulf agency company (gac).  sovana has conducted 
numerous shipments into kuwait.  note: the ak302 process is the import 
procedure for any goods entering kuwait (for the us gov’t / military). the 
contractor’s nominated poc at camp arifjan completes the form and submits 
to kuwaiti customs direct after sgl’s in country agent provides the proper 
documents to them (bol, cipl, etc). this process can take 3 weeks to 90 days. 
as iraq, there are no expedited shipments to kuwait. 
 
 
bahrain – sovana agent: global line services w.l.l  sovana has 
transported multiple shipments to bahrain via us flag air carrier and p2 
ocean service. us military / us embassy consignee is responsible for 
providing levy exemption document as well as clearance approval, which is 
then handed to bahrain customs along with export documentation for formal 
clearance. this process typically takes 5 – 7 days. 
 
 
 
jordan – sovana agent: moveone inc.  sovana has transported many 
shipments to jordan on behalf of the us military, department of defense, 
and us department of state. jordan is a strategic location for many us 
government funded counter terrorism, ata and wps training programs. 
in country agent works with poc in country to obtain any approvals and 
levy exemption documentation prior to transport. normally this process is 
expedient, typically taking 7 – 14 days before greenlight is given to ship.  
 
 
 
oman – sovana agent: worldwide logistics and shipping, llc (wwls). 
sovana has transported many shipments to oman, specifically to the us 
embassy as well as thumrait air base in support of multiple contracts. levy 
exemptions come from us consignee (prior to shipment by air / or cargo

the queen of gospel headlined 
the first jazz festival 
mahalia jackson returned to her hometown 
to make an appearance at the first-ever new 
orleans jazz & heritage festival. attendees 
bubbled with excitement as jackson 
spontaneously joined a parade of second 
line revelers and sang alongside the iconic 
eureka brass band. many people went on to 
believe that this moment birthed the spirit 
of jazz fest - a meeting of jazz and heritage. 
fifty years later, the queen of gospel’s spirit 
continues to live on through her influence on 
music and authenticity. 
visit new orleans and leave with a story, not 
just a souvenir.

we solve renewable power needs with solid oxide 
fuel cell (sofc) innovative technologies  
who is sps: supplying remote power solutions 
sps is strategically aligned with advanced techworks (atw) to design, 
develop, manufacture, and service remote sofc systems throughout all 
of north america, including canada and mexico.  established in 2000 as 
acumentrics sofc, sps is known for innovative r&d solutions and the 
delivery of over 65o sofc power sources in the ranges of 250w to 
1500w  
■ product development: commercial and us dod/doe r&d 
sofc development underway to incorporate emerging sofc 
technology innovations with proven performance including lab/field 
testing and demonstrations leading to reliable power solutions 
■ production:  from project planning to manufacturing operations, 
sps brings a high level of standards and expectations for quality 
products based on high reliability and continuous operations history 
■ field service and sustainment: using remote monitoring 
capabilities, sps has demonstrated performance of 99%+ availability, 6m hours of 
field operations and in-house resources for support (spares/field services), 24/7, 365  
 
 
 
  
sps team differentiators 
we developed unique, proven, and documented products to 
ensure that our customer benefits from three key principles 
based on past experience:  the customer is always right, be 
financially sound and execute flawlessly.  sps proven 
sofc technology is lightweight, modular, fuel flexible and 
cost-efficient gives sofc revolutionary advantages over 
fossil-fuel generators for commercial and dod multi-domain 
operations (mdo).  we have demonstrated performance as 
evidenced by delivery and servicing of 650 units.

edison was contracted by the project’s leed consultant to provide 
leed commissioning services for the caesar’s horseshoe casino 
project in baltimore, md. the $442 million-dollar project is a luxury 
casino in baltimore, md totaling 340,000 square feet, approximately 
110,000 of which is a gaming floor.  the developers wanted to 
promote long term, life cycle cost value by ensuring the energy 
systems were all commissioned for operational excellence. the 
project included three 1000-ton premium efficiency chillers, fiver 
variable speed vertical inline pumps, three cooling towers, a water 
to water heat exchanger, five boilers and 1,200kw combined heat 
and power plant (chp). it was edison energy’s team goal to ensure the building’s overall performance was 
optimized by including energy-efficient design features and directly addressing issues like equipment 
performance, testing, system integration, building efficiency, reliability, maintainability, and comfort; building staff 
members were well-trained and possessed the documentation they needed to operate and maintain the 
buildings’ systems and equipment after turnover; any identified issues were resolved through the commissioning 
process, not just reported. the edison team performed a review of documentation related to the combined heat 
& power system (i.e., tab reports, start-up sheets, control documentation) and was responsible for 
development and distribution of pre-functional performance tests and functional performance tests. 
commissioned by our mid atlantic team with oversite by doug millar, horseshoe casino is one of the only leed 
gold casinos in the country, and in march of 2015, the horseshoe casino baltimore was awarded the president’s 
choice award at the usgbc maryland chapter’s 10th annual wintergreen awards for excellence in green 
building.

hello, 
 
we are summit technology, inc., manufacturer of powersight® power loggers and power 
quality analyzers. we are a certified small business by the state of california department of 
general services. our products, powersight® power analyzers, are easy-to-use, compact power 
testing instruments that provide electrical testing professionals with just about anything they 
want to know about power or power quality. powersight® analyzers and accessories are our 
passion and focus. they are all we make.  
 
in this capability statement, we present the key competencies and differentiators of our 
company, in addition to some past performance examples. we would like to take a moment, 
however, to emphasize and elaborate on four important points about what makes us the ideal 
power analyzer source for any organization, government, agency, company, or institution. 
 
we have the best value analyzers and the lowest cost of ownership in the industry. we 
achieve these superlatives through our unique warranties and maintenance plans. all analyzers 
come with a 1-year warranty, which can be extended at the time of purchase as well as 
reinstated at any time throughout the life of the analyzer. they can even be retroactively 
reinstated, so you can send a meter in for repair after it’s had issues. the warranties include 
firmware updates, yearly calibrations, bug fixes, and more (more details here). some users 
have our analyzers for 15+ years because we build them to last and service them to become 
like-new for a low price–indefinitely. 
 
we have the widest range of accessories and operating ranges, ensuring your success in 
analyzing any source or load anywhere in the world. this includes direct connect to 4160v 
motors, 12.5kv distribution, 2000a dc transit, and much, much more. 
 
we have unique features and accessories to minimize errors and increase efficiency 
throughout the monitoring process. wizards check connections, aid setup, and write reports. 
our analyzers are the only ones that can have the entire test plan loaded into them for error-free 
efficient logging, according to plan. 
 
in addition to selling, we have possibly the largest rental stock of power analyzers in north 
america. being a small business doesn’t stop us from maintaining a fleet of hundreds of 
analyzers for rent. we take long and short-term rental orders of up to 100 analyzers, and we 
have money-saving solutions when you rent longer or purchase the equipment after renting. 
learn more here.  
 
our responsive, domestic technical support is knowledgeable and reachable. during business 
hours (m-f, 8am-5pm pst), we answer technical support calls from users in the field. no 
robots, no tedious phone menus; just great, fast service provided in-house.  
 
we are experienced, proven, and work with you to achieve your goals. over the years, we have 
done business with all us military branches, the federal government, us embassies, local 
governments, utilities, universities, and more. references can be provided upon request. we 
pivot quickly and always focus on crafting the right solution for your unique situation.  
 
our job isn’t done until your job is successful!

core competencies 
summit technology, inc. manufactures powersight® power analyzers and loggers. powersight analyzers provide answers to just about any 
question about electric power and power quality, enabling power testing professionals to perform load studies, energy audits, power 
quality studies, etc. powersight analyzers are easy-to-use. there are affordable models with solutions for monitoring everything from basic 
amp/volt/power measurements to detection of instantaneous power quality events and power-line noise spectra. they are designed with 
the end user in mind, so they are compact enough to comfortably fit in one hand and fit inside small electrical panels with the door shut.

company information 
a proven provider of logistics engineering, sustainment, and operational support technical services to both federal 
and commercial clients… goldbelt integrated logistics services, llc is quickly becoming a leading provider of 
comprehensive logistics and systems engineering support requirements including reliability centered maintenance (rcm) 
analysis, maintenance procedure development and integrated logistics support planning for sustainment and new platform 
acquisitions. we have extensive capabilities in both dimensional and electronic calibration including weapon system 
components. gbils supports customer warehousing requirements by providing shipping, receiving and operations support. 
goldbelt integrated logistics services has an established quality management system in compliance with iso 9001:2015 
with a management team committed to delivering quality services.

contracting with an alaska native corporation 
the 1971 alaska native claims settlement act (ancsa) approved by u.s. congress provided financial and land-distribution 
rights to alaska native corporations like goldbelt, inc., goldbelt integrated logistics services’ parent company. in accordance 
with federal acquisition regulation (far) 6.302-5(b)(4), 6.303-1(b) and 19.808-1(a), the government may award a sole 
source contract to an anc 8(a) company for: a) up to $100m without a justification and approval (j&a); and b) more than 
$100m with a j&a, which cannot be protested by law.

history and heritage 
goldbelt, inc., goldbelt integrated logistics services’ parent company, is an alaska native corporation first and foremost, 
and we draw on and uphold the principles of our culture: family, diligence, and respect. these qualities remind us of our past, 
define our present, and guide our future. 
incorporated in 1974, goldbelt was organized under the alaska native claims settlement act (ansca) as the urban 
corporation representing the juneau area, though shareholders have family roots throughout southeast alaska’s vibrant 
tlingit and haida communities. the tlingit people are the indigenous people of the southeast region, whose rich history spans 
more than ten thousand years. goldbelt was formed with 2,722 original shareholders and now represents more than 3,900 
shareholders and descendants.

company overview: 
ihg hotels & resorts is one of the world’s leading hotels companies, with 350,000 colleagues working across more than 
100 countries to deliver true hospitality for good.  
our diverse portfolio of differentiated brands are well known and loved by millions of consumers around the world.  we 
have the right hotel brand for our guests and owners, whatever their needs.  
we take the safety and security of guests, colleagues and visitors to ihg hotels & resorts very seriously.  we manage 
safety and security through a global management system that includes brand safety standards and a suite of risk 
guidance, training and toolkits that are available to all hotels.  
as a global organization operating in more thank 100 countries, with over 3500,000 colleagues, we recognize the 
importance and benefit of ensuring our workforce embodies the communities in which we operate. our policies and 
standards set out our position on social, environmental and ethical issues.  
 
responsible business 
the definition of what it means to be a responsible business continues to evolve. how companies operate and behave is 
receiving more focus from wider society than ever before. this in turn is having a greater influence on the perceptions 
and decisions of a broader set of stakeholders, including investors, consumers and colleagues. 
at ihg, we understand the importance of operating responsibly and sustainably – it is absolutely core to our business and 
culture. in recent years, we have made important progress in targeting operational, people-led and environmental issues 
most material to us and our stakeholders, broadening our focus and our impact as part of our promise to provide true 
hospitality for good. we are proud of our progress on what is a journey towards making an increasingly positive 
difference to our people, communities and the world around us.

about us 
the institute for perception, founded in 1993, is a full-service statistical and market research consulting firm. 
we conduct extensive research on new models of human perception to provide a basis for methods to support  
product development, market research, and advertising claim substantiation. our extensive network of fieldwork partners  
allows us to manage and execute projects almost anywhere in the world, in central location, home use, or internet-based settings. 
 
the institute for perception 
offers comprehensive client services 
to assist in the development process 
of new and/or improved products and 
marketing concepts: 
visit www.ifpress.com for detailed information about the institute for perception.

shipping policy details:
jacobs gardner ships fob destination to the 48 contiguous states and

specific freight quotes will be provided to the customer. additional freight fees may

our signed proof of delivery receipt from the transportation company for a shipment

responsibility ceases.

representative programs
department of homeland security 
office renovation | washington, dc
general construction & renovation
jade creek performed design, bid, build construction 
services for the gsa-leased office renovations for the office 
of the chief information office (ocio). our team removed 
and rebuilt the offices, refurbished conference rooms, and 
built furniture cubicles and workstations in open areas. the 
project also included a series of minor alterations and repairs 
for life safety, hvac, audio-visuals, electrical, and it cabling. 
u.s. army corps of engineers 
barracks renovation | fort lee, virginia
general construction & renovation
 
sister company portico completed a total interior demolition 
and renovation to silver leed standards of the three-story 
barracks at fort lee, encompassing 76,000 square-feet. 
the team installed all new mechanical, plumbing, and 
electrical systems; installed a new roof including total joist 
replacement; and incorporated blast-proof steel supports 
and straps into the overall construction. 
u.s. air force, 45th space wing 
electrical generator replacement | ascension island, 
british overseas territory
general construction & renovation
on a remote south atlantic island, sister company portico 
repaired the generators which are the only source of 
electrical power available to the ascension island auxiliary 
air field (aaf). the team removed four existing gensets 
and associated systems and installed four new 2500km 
caterpillar engine generators, new exhaust systems, 
and new cooling systems. the project required the 
secure shipment of materials via barge from florida to 
ascension island in accordance with international shipping 
requirements and federal regulations.
u.s. army corps of engineers 
maintenance dredging | chesapeake city anchorage 
basin, virginia
civil & marine construction
jade creek performed 15,000 yards of mechanical dredging in 
the chesapeake & delaware canal and 62,000 yards of hydraulic 
dredging in the basin within a short 60-day time frame. despite 
the team facing prolonged periods of single digit temperatures, 
the project was first runner up for the coastal dredging project 
of the year.
u.s. army corps of engineers 
seawall repair | aberdeen proving ground (apg), 
maryland
civil & marine construction
the existing apg boat dock, constructed in the 1930s, faced 
erosion and undermining of the concrete apron at the point of 
landfall and the aprons to the north and south of the landfall 
point. jade creek performed a complete overhaul, including 
excavation, black-top paving removal, concrete apron, sidewalk, 
utility trenching and backfill for new electric service, and 
trucking and placement of soil and rip-rap products to restore 
the dock to peak functionality. 
u.s. army corps of engineers 
fort mifflin disposal facility | philadelphia and new 
jersey 
civil & marine construction 
 
sister company portico provided the excavation, loading, 
transportation, and disposal or beneficial use of an estimated 
150,000 to 450,000 tons of dredged material removed from 
the fort mifflin disposal facility. all work was performed 
in compliance with state, local and federal environmental 
regulations.

overview of jw photography 
creates web based applications (browser based software) of 360° walkthroughs. high resolution 
360° images are captured on site, edited and stitched into equirectangular panoramas. all images 
are retouched to remove the appearance and shadow of the camera, photographer or other 
persons and ppi within the tour. 3d tour is programmed to have custom elements throughout the 
space to engage the user in interacting in their surroundings.  
software and tools 
though we have used matterport, the customization offered in the 3d vista software is superior. 
it provides a full open source file code (which may be white labeled to remove all photographer 
and software logo and branding), can be hosted on servers such as aws east, aws govcloud 
(both of which we act as csp) and analytics tracked. the customizations we are offering are 
superior to matterport in the following ways: 
the images are programmed to connect with our custom created icons (dots, arrows, logos or 
animated icons) to show the user which direction to navigate. we can capture images at the best 
view for the user (unlike matterport needing close 
images for connecting algorithm during capture, 
matterport requires movement between captures to me 
no more than 5-8 feet). all post production connections 
make the user feel as they have 3d dynamic 
movement, while seeing the best view of the space and 
objects. 
custom menus are created to give the user added information, showcase images from the space, 
display logos, embed or open new tab for website, call/ email buttons, download pdf 
photogrammetry of objects can be included with an iframe in the tour, user would click to enable 
a 3d model that can be manipulated and turned.  
lidar scanning can create a floorpan for the space. as well full 3d models can be custom created 
by our modeling team to have the user open in a digitally rendered space, but navigate a 
walkthrough done in physical images. 
many tours can be grouped together in a virtual showcase as we have done with multi-building 
facilities tours can be made fully ada section 508 complaint.  
experience:  
our team has had experience in creating 360 immersive tours for different industries, with many 
custom tours of homes. we have created virtual experiences in a 360 virtual rendered 
environment created from blender and unity software. we are able to capture images indoors as 
well as outdoors, and have experience with reflective surfaces (an area where the matterport 
camera struggles to get a capture). our current team can handle a workload of 10 tours a week, 
with a turn around time of 2 weeks for live hosted link delivery. our team is available to travel 
on site for capture of images. 
though new to government contracting we have created tours for the united states army corps 
of engineers at the rock island arsenal mississippi river visitors center. a project which 
showcases our ability to entwine the history of the lock and dam system and ability to use 
interactive educational trivia and downloadable resources. 
examples of tours: 
museum tour with 3d model, i spy and trivia game. 
https://putnam.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/index.htm 
home example with invisible hotspots:  
https://qcrealestate.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/8517+54th+coal+valley/index.htm 
virtual tour of home with menu and custom hotspots: 
https://qcrealestate.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/1883+stagecoach/index.htm 
virtual project walkthrough for usace ria: 
https://quadcities.s3.us-east-2.amazonaws.com/ria/index.htm 
improvements to the 2020 virtual village 
menu format and ui can remain the same or be upgraded to have different elements for the user. 
using 3d vista as the only software allows a more seamless flow for the user between the main 
page of the virtual village with rendered exteriors of the properties. as well as remaining in the 
main viewer, unlike matterport opening in a web frame. 
e-learning within the 3d vista tour program can be used to showcase pop-up scavenger hunt 
questions within the tour, unlike the 2020 scavenger hunt which had the user open a second page 
for a pdf.  
each virtual home will have a 3d model designed uniquely for each tour and models will be 
aligned in a “village” format. the user will be able to walk freely between properties and 
navigate the space. we suggest less 3d modeled people, they do not offer any engaging 
interaction for the user and are a distraction to the tour. instead we would offer informational pop 
ups of the challenge and teams within the tour (also will be accessible through the menu). 
embedded video, projected images and pdf files call all be accessed within the tour. providing 
clickable and engaging content is the key to ensuring the user remains and interacts on the site.  
virtual reality functionality is not fully operational on the 2020 tour. this is due to the skin 
elements not being compatible in vr and causes the user to not see the home or be able to enter 
the matterport tour. we will create a fully functioning virtual reality version of the tour, 
allowing the user to enter each home and tour freely.  
 
sample images from the 2020 solar decathlon tour in vr on a mobile device (homes missing, 
user not able to enter tour).

conduct rf surveys to determine proper placement of wireless

▪ officially formalized in 1980, 
the native village of eyak
(nve) is a federally recognized 
tribal government that 
promotes self-determination 
to its tribal members.
▪ the village is nestled in the 
chugach mountains bordered 
by the prince william sound 
and the copper river delta’s 
waters located on the eastern 
gulf of alaska
▪ as a sovereign nation, nve 
governs themselves within the 
borders of the united states
▪ founded in 2006, copper river 
it became the first operating 
company to enter into the sba 
8(a) program.
▪ copper river it has the unique 
distinction of completing all 
nine years within the program, 
successfully graduating in 
2015. 
▪ the success of copper river it 
evolved into the creation of 
copper river shared services 
in 2016, serving as the back-
office services model that 
supports all the copper river 
family of companies. 
▪ this streamlined structure has 
enabled the copper river 
family of companies to grow 
through the acquisition and 
creation of multiple new 
companies. 
▪ copper river management 
company oversees a growing 
number of entities owned by the 
native village of eyak, which 
includes:
