Energy projects Global Enterprises International, Inc. is a Florida corporation formed in 1989.  Its original mission was confined to political, economic and security consulting with special emphasis on the Middle East.  At the request of its clients Global began to provide security and intelligence equipment and training to friendly Middle Eastern countries.  Eventually Global became unique in its field, offering security services that could not be found elsewhere.
Again at the request of some clients, Global became an international trader, mostly in cement and petroleum products.  Using key contacts in the Middle East and in Russian, Global has access to markets and products that enable it to supply products at very competitive prices.
In 2008 Global began to concentrate on construction and development.  Triggering this concentration was the acquisition of the Turkish construction company Eska, which included commitments for the long-term employment of Eskas key personnel, to include its former Chairman and CEO, Mr. Selim Edes.  Eska, with Mr. Edes at the helm, built many large structures and complexes to include housing and other base facilities for the U.S. Air Force at Incirlik, Turkey; The Atakoy Tourism Center, Istanbul; Atasehir Project, Club Aldiana & Paradise in Antalya; the Dalyan-Bostanci Land Reclamation Project in Istanbul and finally the Atakoy Galleria in Istanbul.  More information about these projects can be Vision. Our company has extensive experience in the Middle East area and we are committed to strengthening the economies and infrastructure of the countries in which we work. We see the big picture and wish to participate in building strong nations that are economically and politically vibrant.

Integrity. While we are a private company that must watch the bottom line, we are committed to dealing honestly and fairly with our clients so that we are able to deliver a world class product at a fair price, while still making a reasonable profit.

Experience. Our staff has extensive experience in developing large scale projects from the initial concept and design to final completion. We also have extensive experience in the area and know how to seamlessly blend our development efforts with the cultural customs of the area.

Relationships. While Global has a vast amount of experience in project development, we are not experts in all fields and thus we have teamed with other companies who have the expertise we may lack. Additionally, we have close ties to a number financial institutes and through these ties we are able to provide our clients with low cost financing. Lastly, we have relationships with a number of U.S. manufacturers that allow us to obtain priority access to products so that projects can develop and come to fruition quickly.

Global Enterprises - Our History
Global Enterprises International, Inc. is a Florida corporation formed in 1989.  Its original mission was confined to political, economic and security consulting with special emphasis on the Middle East.  At the request of its clients Global began to provide security and intelligence equipment and training to friendly Middle Eastern countries.  Eventually Global became unique in its field, offering security services that could not be found elsewhere.
Again at the request of some clients, Global became an international trader, mostly in cement and petroleum products.  Using key contacts in the Middle East and in Russian, Global has access to markets and products that enable it to supply products at very competitive prices.
In 2008 Global began to concentrate on construction and development.  Triggering this concentration was the acquisition of the Turkish construction company Eska, which included commitments for the long-term employment of Eskas key personnel, to include its former Chairman and CEO, Mr. Selim Edes.  Eska, with Mr. Edes at the helm, built many large structures and complexes to include housing and other base facilities for the U.S. Air Force at Incirlik, Turkey; The Atakoy Tourism Center, Istanbul; Atasehir Project, Club Aldiana & Paradise in Antalya; the Dalyan-Bostanci Land Reclamation Project in Istanbul and finally the Atakoy Galleria in Istanbul.  More information about these projects can be found under Our Activities > Completed Projects" section.

Energy / Electricty	 
Global has developed a close working relationship with United Technologies Corporation (UTC), whose subsidiaries include Pratt & Whitney and Clipper. Pratt & Whitney is best known for its jet engines, and they have adapted these engines for use as electrical producing turbines. Pratt & Whitney's MobilePac, which produces 25 MW of power, comes in two trailers which can be delivered in one aircraft and installed within 8 hours after arrival on site. The MobilePacs are indeed mobile, so if emergencies develop, they can easily be transferred to other areas.

Pratt & Whitney also produces a SwiftPac Power Plant that can provide either 30 or 60 MW of power using either gas or diesel fuel. In 2013 Pratt & Whitney will also produce a 120 MW power plant. While the SwiftPacs are not as mobile or as quickly installed as the MobilePacs, they can be installed in less than 30 days with minimal site preparation, thus delivering reliable power in a very short period of time.

As mentioned above Clipper is also part of the UTC family and Global works closely with them too. Clipper produces a 2.5 MW wind turbine that uses the latest wind technology and is extremely easy to maintain. Wind turbines are growing more important in today's environmentally concerned world, and in areas with good wind conditions they offer a favorable alternative to fossil fuel turbines.

Global's engineers are can maintain a wide variety of power plants and many different kinds of turbines. We also have the capability of refurbishing turbines that are either not operable or are not operating at efficient levels. We can refurbish such turbines and return them to "as new" condition.

Also in the Energy area, Global offers solutions that can transfer municipal waste into electrical energy. These solutions, like wind solutions, are becoming more attractive to environmentally concerned nations and offer a much more sanitary solution to waste than landfills.		


Construction	 
Global or one of our teaming partners has experience in almost all areas of construction to include:
Schools
Hospitals
Dams
Housing projects
Power plants
Bridges
Drainage and Sewer systems
Airports


Multi-Fold System

A construction system called multi-fold reinforced concrete system for casting the concrete of houses and apartment buildings very rapidly where walls and slabs were cast on top of each other, connected with hinges and lifted the units to unfold into apartments.

First application was the Family Housing Project at US Air Force Air Base at Incirlik, Adana, Turkey during 1981 and 1982. Close to 1000 family houses were built with a fast track design-build method.During the following ten years the system was used successfully in many projects.

The application was basically for projects with multi-storey buildings of 500 or more units. The application of the system exceeded 2 million square meters. All the projects executed with this system were completed turn- key in less than 12 months.

Among the clients were US Air Force (Military family housing), Turkish Ministry of Defense (Military family housing), Turkish Ministry of Interior (Family housing for policemen), Municipality of Istanbul (Housing for Municipality staff), Turkish Ministry of Education (Dormitories for 20,000 students completed turn-key design- build including FF&E in 4 months).

Finance	 
Global maintains close relationships with a number of financial institutes that can benefit our clients and Global's own projects. Specifically, we can arrange loans at low interest rates on large projects with U.S. Government agencies, such as the United States Export-Import Bank (EXIM) and the Overseas Private Investment Corporation (OPIC). EXIM rates and terms are subject to change in each country, but typical long term loans are for 10 years. However, "green projects", such as wind driven power plants or solar power, can extend the term of a loan to 20 years. In cases where U.S. agencies are not appropriate for financial support, we can turn to commercial institutes with whom we also have excellent relations. We have experts who work with these various institutes and they can help our clients obtain the best financial solution available for their projects.

For over 28 years, our dedication to quality and service has made First to the Finish the complete source for track and field. We have built our reputation on providing track and field coaches and athletes a reliable source for quality apparel, equipment, and accessories.

FIRST TO THE FINISH INC. HISTORY
Mike Viano, founder and owner, began First to the Finish in the basement of his home. As an avid runner, Mike wanted to provide a service to track and field coaches and athletes. What started in a small basement has now grown into one of the three largest mail order businesses in the country dealing with track and field equipment and apparel. In the beginning, the word on First to the Finish got out by one page fliers, we now send out multiple catalogs including a 195 page full color catalog. We offer a full service website where you can review products and order online.

HUGE INVENTORY
First to the Finish warehouses over 100,000 pairs of track and field spikes and training shoes for same day shipping. We are also one of the largest track and field equipment dealers in the country, putting us well above the competition. Most orders are shipped with in 24-48 hours and satisfaction is always guaranteed.

ONSITE SCREENING CAPABILITIES
We custom screen print and embroider all orders in house. This enables us to give you the best possible service with the fastest turnaround. Our talented screen print and graphic department are available to assist you with all your custom needs. We have gone to great lengths to make your custom purchase as easy as possible.

OUR #1 GOAL IS SERVICE!
Our friendly customer service reps are eager to serve your track and field needs. They can assist with all aspects of your order from selecting the best training shoe to ordering custom screening for your uniforms. With our computerized inventory and online order tracking, we provide you with the best customer service.

Cherokee Federal's team of companies offer a unique approach to humanitarian solutions through a unifying concept called Team Hope.

Team Hope is a group of uniquely capable and passionate professionals focused on provided specialized staffing resources, emergency services and the critical assets and systems needed to deliver culturally compassionate care to vulnerable populations. We have partnered with the federal government in response to dozens of urgent missions around the globe. Our most recent experience includes caring for and reuniting children from the Northern Triangle with parents or sponsors and supporting Afghan refugees whove fled their home country to seek safety in the U.S.

100% of our profits go to serve citizens of the Cherokee Nation, many who are still impacted by multi-generational impacts of cultural uprooting, a nearly impossible journey filled with stories of loss, resiliency and triumph. 

 

This a full circle moment for us, a population of resettlement survivors and their descendants. Our work allows us to give hope to vulnerable people in need of compassionate and culturally appropriate care. We see this as an opportunity to alter the course of history by creating a more hopeful future for those we serve and generations to follow.

Rapid COVID-19 Testing Solutions
Fast, Effective & Scalable FDA approved/EUA Tests. 

All organizations  business, government and nonprofit  want to restore operations as quickly and safely as possible. They need a well-coordinated, well-executed health security plan. Cherokee Federal has partnered with industry leaders to offer a comprehensive COVID-19 testing program, featuring a combination of FDA approved and emergency use authorized (EUA) tests, clinical staff, logistics and data analytics.

Our turn-key approach is scalable and modular. We help agencies strengthen entry and exit protocols, contain infection risks, alert staff, perform contact tracing, and monitor worksite conditions in real time. Cherokee Federal helps clients coordinate each component easily and effectively. Contact us today.

Around the world, COVID-19 remains a threat to operational continuity. Employees and visiting stakeholders need to know you have their health security in mind.
Health security seeks answers to questions, such as:
 How can we maximize traffic flow & reduce operational impacts?
 How can we quickly deploy on-site health screening and COVID-19 testing solutions?
 How can we monitor the health of on-site employees & visitors?
 How can we implement touchless solutions throughout our facility?
 How can we safely isolate individuals who show symptoms of infection?

Partnering with Cherokee Federal has many advantages, including answers and solutions to the above questions. Not only can we help improve your teams health security, we can provide you the steps to make your workplace safer, construct facilities with your choice of health security features, and shield your clinicians and security staff with our line of modular, biosecurity products. 

COVID-19 Mission Support
In the effort against the COVID-19 pandemic, federal agencies deserve the most renowned, reliable and responsive teams at their side to achieve critical missions. Through an arsenal of capabilities and contracting vehicles, our team of companies offers superior mission support services. When demand surges, Cherokee Federals rapidly scaling teams mobilize to meet whatever the circumstances require. We are uniquely qualified to help federal customers respond to that demand across all our lines of business. Learn more about our comprehensive COVID-19 testing program, and other health security solutions, to help your organization protect its workforce and safely restore normal operations.

Ready to Serve

An improvement in delivery of business

Rapid Response Past Performance
Cherokee is equipped to respond to COVID-19 in ways that few federal contractors begin to approach. Our team of companies offer an array of services and expertise. Below are examples of our ability to respond rapidly, reliably and responsibly in times of need.

When Seconds Matter: Deepwater Horizon Spill Recovery
Within 36 hours of receiving notice to pursue work addressing the Deepwater Horizon spill, Cherokee responded. Across the Gulf of Mexico, Cherokee rapidly dispatched 75 safety auditors and observers. Our well-trained staff had OSHA 40-hour Hazwoper and HAZMAT certifications, ensuring avoidance of workplace hazards during the long effort to mitigate the environmental impact of a 4.9-million-barrel oil spill.
Renowned Expertise: Hurricane Katrina Disaster Recovery Assistance
By quickly ramping up the necessary staff in response to Hurricane Katrina, Cherokees technical support services assisted federal recovery efforts throughout Louisiana and Mississippi  helping affected communities rebuild at every step along the way. The technical support team provided critical public assistance operations and complete debris removal, while our civil and structural engineering support team restored community infrastructure. Our municipal cost accounting provided important oversight, and together with our architectural and construction review, ensured the responsible standards Cherokee adheres to on all contracts were set in stone.

 

Reliable from Start to Finish: Five Years of 100% Supplier Performance
Cherokee Federals team of engineering and manufacturing companies has a long history of providing superior service on long-running programs with difficult technical requirements. For this five-year defense contract, Cherokee produced interconnect wire assemblies, instrument panels and other limited source details for military aircraft. Cherokee maintained a supplier performance rating of 100%, on both quality and delivery, for the duration of the program. Through seamless integration and constant communication, our quality, manufacturing, testing, engineering and product launch teams proactively identified and mitigated risks. The contract was a build-to-print requirement, with approximately 500 engineering changes from the defense firm on the products Cherokee manufactured.

 

Consistent Quality at Any Scale
When demand surges, Cherokee scales whether its establishing call centers and support desks or manufacturing products that power life-saving equipment, like tactical quiet generators (TQGs). During a 10-year contract to manufacture TQGs for a defense contractor, Cherokee maintained a >99% on-time delivery and quality rating. Continuous improvement that utilized Kaizen, 5S, and other lean tools gave Cherokee the flexibility to scale rapidly. Surge demand from our customers increased monthly deliveries of TQGs as much as 25% with very little notice, and without cutting corners. To anticipate such demand, Cherokee maintained quality and on-time delivery through a production cell concept. This concept minimized wasted motion, improved product flow and resolved product issues. Production cells demonstrably improved the overall efficiency of TQG build and test times  year after year.

About Action Battery
Action Battery Wholesalers, Inc. (ABW) is a full sales and service provider for all your DC power requirements. We provide products and services to all markets with critical power needs including telecommunications, electrical utility, industrial and data center UPS applications, as well solar and alternative energies.

Action Battery was started by Tim and Judy Dove out of their garage over 35 years ago & it continues to be family owned and operated.  We have strong Midwest roots and family values, which influences every aspect of our operation. Our goal is customer satisfaction 100% of the time.  Our reputation in the industry and high rate of returning customers demonstrates we are meeting that goal.

Our core group of employees has a combined experience of over 150 years in all aspects of the back-up power industry and has the knowledge and expertise to assist you.  Everyone from our administrative and operations staff, field technicians and sales team are committed to customer satisfaction. We get your projects completed safely, to the highest standards and on time.

We understand what your business needs, and it is our #1 priority to make sure your business is always up and running  24 hours a day/7 days per week and to your satisfaction.

Action Battery Services
Our Field Service Technicians are committed to safely completing their work to the highest standards, in a timely manner and on your schedule.

In addition, Action Battery has a large Fleet of Service Vehicles in various sizes and capacities that are fully equipped with all necessary tools and parts. This not only allows us to safely transport equipment, power plants and batteries to most locations ourselves using DOT certified drivers, but also to handle any unexpected contingencies so we can get your job done in one trip.

Our Service Department is prepared and equipped to assist you in the following areas:

Installation
Whether you are looking for battery replacement or a new system, we are here to assist you. Our Field Service Technicians perform each installation in accordance with manufacturer specifications and industry standards. No installation is too difficult. Most importantly, our technicians work around your schedule so there is no downtime and you can stay online.

Capacity Testing
Capacity testing batteries that back up your equipment is the proven method to determine how the battery will perform during a power outage. We test per Manufacturer Specifications and in accordance with relevant IEEE Standards.  We use the state of the art Alber BCT Capacity Test System, which both controls and continuously monitors the test. Once the batteries have been tested, we provide a comprehensive report of the results; as well as any recommendations for repairs or replacements that need to be made in the near future. There are many benefits to performing battery testing, some of which include: Comparing your battery to the useful life specified by the manufacturer; reducing battery replacement rate and frequency; and Identifying weak cells and faulty intercell connections.

Preventive Maintenance
The best way to reduce the risk of downtime is to get on a regular Preventive Maintenance Program. Action Battery will work with you to tailor a plan that works best for your needs. Typical programs are designed to meet manufacturer requirements, that keep your warranty valid, as well as those that meet the most current IEEE Standards. Our programs can detect even the slightest problems that, left undetected, could lead to costly repairs or system replacement.

Consulting/Engineering
Our experienced staff is available to assist in the review, design and engineering of your DC Power Systems and sites. We have the knowledge and experience to review site plans and specifications to provide you with the best recommendations to achieve your desired results. In addition, we can visit the site and perform a site survey to obtain accurate site information and identify any potential problems.

Hot Cutovers
A Hot Cutover is the process of replacing a Battery or DC Power System while the equipment is still running.  This is done without interruption of service or downtime. This procedure takes very careful and detailed planning.  Prior to performing a Hot Cutover, Action Battery will perform the following tasks: cutover scheduling, logistics planning, sequence and safety planning and cutover documentation. This is a process that cannot, and should not, be trusted to just anybody. Our Field Service Technicians have the experience, training and expertise to do it accurately & on-time.

Battery Recycling
Action Battery complies with all state, local and federal regulations regarding battery disposal.  Upon proper battery disposal, youll receive a certificate documenting that weve complied with all EPA rules and regulations.

24 Hour Emergency Services
Action Battery has certified and trained Field Service Technicians that are on call 24 hours a day/7 days per week/365 days per year. We have a large inventory of used rectifiers and batteries that can be delivered and installed right away, on a temporary basis, in the case of an emergency. We also carry a large inventory of new products, at our Somerset, WI facility & these products can be delivered and installed in a very short time frame, or even the same day.

We receive calls, on a near daily basis, from people unable to leave their home or business because of a garage door that refuses to open. With our 24-hour garage door repair service, you are never far from freedom. Getting people on their way, protecting their assets from theft and harsh weather conditions, and keeping people safe are what make us proud of what we do.

When it comes to garage door repair, its important to remember that attempting to fix it yourself should never be an option. Many components, particularly garage door springs, are under extreme tension and are likely to cause severe damage to you and those around you. If you have a broken spring, or any other garage door issue, our humble team of experienced technicians will have your fix done quickly, precisely, and safely.

Through our years of garage door repair experience, the most common issue among homeowners and business owners, is a broken spring. Commonly blamed on the garage door opener, a broken garage door spring can be hard to identify and is extremely dangerous. In order to determine whether or not your issue is related to the spring, look or listen for these common signs:

A loud, one-time noise from your garage
Garage door wont open, or will only open a few inches
Your garage door spring hasnt been replaced in the past 5-7 years
An obvious break in the spring
From commercial and residential doors to basic openers and controllers, our Fargo garage door repair team is experienced in all makes, models, and sizes. Additionally, our team is experienced in Midwestern work ethic, transparency, and relating to our customers. Its as important to us to educate you on the workings of your garage door as it is to conduct the actual repair. You deserve to know exactly what is wrong with your garage door and why we are doing what we are doing.

Its amazing how many repair jobs we conduct each year that, if properly maintained, could have been easily prevented. Whether you are a homeowner or a business owner, you fully depend on your residential or commercial garage door(s) to function properly, on a daily basis. A properly functioning garage door is crucial to:

Conducting your daily activities
Protecting your belongings, or business assets, from theft and detrimental weather conditions
Proper energy efficiency in your home or business
Keeping your family, or workers, safe from potential harm
Thats why regularly-scheduled, preventive maintenance is so important. Our garage door maintenance not only decreases costly downtime in the event of unforeseen damage, it also drastically decreases repair expenses over time. Eliminate your need for emergency repairs, and keep your garage door functioning properly all year long, by scheduling yearly maintenance with Overhead Door of Fargo.

WHAT DOES PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE ENTAIL?
Preventative maintenance is focused on keeping your doors in peak condition at all times, as opposed to waiting for an issue to arise and responding with the necessary repair. Among other important factors, preventative maintenance includes:

Garage Doors

Inspect, adjust, and lubricate springs
As the most dangerous feature of any garage door, NEVER attempt to repair your doors spring. Inspect regularly and have a professional make all necessary repairs.

Inspect spring mounting pad for cracks and splits
Inspect door and track alignment/balance
If your garage door, and its tracks, arent properly balanced or aligned, it wont properly open. Over time, this improper opening will cause issues in all other parts of your system.

Inspect and lubricate all rollers
Rollers, regardless of material, need to be inspected twice per year and replaced every 7 years. If any chips, excessive wear, or cracks are detected, rollers should be replaced immediately.

Inspect and tighten hinges and hardware
The average garage door door moves up and down more than a thousand times a year.

Lubricate all bearings
Inspect cables for wear or damage
With enough force to cause death, never tinker with high-tension cables. However, its important to check for any damage and if damage is present, have cables replaced immediately.

Inspect locks for proper operation
Inspect weather strip for wear or damage
If the rubber weather stripping on the bottom of your door, and along the garage door frame, are cracked or brittle, replacement is needed. A proper seal keeps the elements out and proper energy efficiency in.

Garage Door Openers

Test your Auto-Reverse feature regularly
If you garage door system doesnt include an auto-reverse feature, have one installed as soon as possible.

Inspect for proper operation
Adjust up and down force sensitivity
Tighten drive chain/belt as needed
Lubricate drive train and sprockets
Check wiring and connections
Set up and down limits as needed
Inspect all internal gears and belts
Check transmitter and wall stations for proper operation and range
Keypad and transmitter batteries are checked

We know better than most that there are a number of reasons for needing, or wanting, a new garage door. Whatever the reason, its our promise to provide a seamless experience, wide variety of options, and the highest quality product. At Overhead Door of Fargo, our garage door installation service will have you fitted with the garage door system that fits your unique needs and budget.

Full garage door installation & replacement
Whether you are fitting your new home with a custom garage door or replacing your warehouse door systems, finding the perfect door, and opener system, can be difficult and stressful. Through a collaboration of your needs and our expertise, the perfect solution is born.

A proper functioning garage door system is essential to conducting daily activities, both personally and professionally, and protecting your assets from theft and weather conditions. Combine this with the look you desire most and your garage door serves a purpose far beyond simply opening and closing.

If you havent already, explore our wide selection of residential garage doors, commercial doors, and opener systems. Interested in seeing what a garage door from Overhead Door will look like on your home? Our DoorView interactive software allows you to do just that.

Section Replacement
Accidents, storms, and other unforeseen events are bound to happen. When the unexpected does happen, it is likely that you wont need your entire garage door repaired or replaced. With section replacement, return your garage door to its original condition without spending money on an entire replacement. Depending on your door type and age, our technicians will implement a new section(s) that blends seamlessly with all other sections.

Man-Installing-Garage-Door

It doesnt matter what type of garage door you have  if your garage door system is broken or unreliable, you are vulnerable to safety issues and extreme inconvenience. Overhead Door offers a range of residential garage door openers, opener accessories, commercial operators, and commercial operator accessories to equip your home or business with an integrated door system that handles multiple garage door weights and sizes. As your garage doors engine, we install the opener system that best meets your garage door needs.


As the most common, and dangerous, issues with garage doors, broken springs and cables need to be replaced immediately. Luckily, these issues rarely mean a complete opener replacement. With severe injury and further damage as serious threats, it is essential to have one of our professional garage door installation technicians conduct the repair or replacement.

INSPECTION SERVICES
 

Guidedwave engineers are available to assist or lead inspection service jobs on a limited basis. We specialize in difficult to inspect structures and first time inspections. We are available to assist new inspectors in the field and review data to assist companies and personnel new to guided waves. Lastly, we are available to assist in implementing new guided wave technologies. Feel free to contact us for our most recent rates.

Specializing in:

Helping companies new to guided waves
Data review
First time inspections
Difficult to inspect structures
Introduction of new guided wave technologies

OTHER TECHNOLOGIES
In addition to a comprehensive suite of commercially-available NDT and SHM systems, Guidedwave continues to pioneer new technologies that utilize ultrasonic guided waves. A few examples of our technologies that are still under research and development are:

 

Ultrasonic De-Icing
ULTRASONIC DE-ICING
Ultrasonic de-icing is non-thermal and consumes much less power than comparable electro-thermal blanket systems. It is also safe for composite materials that may be damaged by thermal de-icing methods.

Learn More
Pigging Technologies
PIGGING TECHNOLOGIES
Non-contact, EMAT generated guided wave ultrasound is a promising technology for the detection of coating disbondments, cracking, and corrosion.

Learn More
Rail Inspection
RAIL INSPECTION
Guided waves are optimal for detecting transverse defects in rail, which are a critical type of defect that is very difficult to detect using traditional ultrasonic rail inspection techniques.


Ice Sensing
ICE SENSING
Guidedwaves ultrasonic ice sensing solution requires no hazardous materials, can be delivered at a substantial cost savings to other alternatives, and can deliver excellent sensitivity.


Nonlinear Guided Waves
NONLINEAR GUIDED WAVES
Nonlinear ultrasonic guided waves are known as one of the best approaches for characterizing changes in dislocation density and slip bands that precede the initiation of a fatigue crack.


Guided Wave Tomographic Plate/Shell Monitoring System
GUIDED WAVE TOMOGRAPHIC PLATE/SHELL MONITORING SYSTEM
UTOMO technology was developed specifically for large-area structural health monitoring (SHM) of aircraft components to eliminate the need for expensive, time-consuming, localized inspections.

Systems
SYSTEMS
Guidedwave offers a suite of comprehensive NDT and SHM solutions for a wide range of applications including the inspection of pipes, plates, storage tanks, and more.


Probes
PROBES
Guidedwave offers a variety of probes for various guided wave inspection techniques and applications including plates, shells, pipes, and more.


Software
SOFTWARE
Guidedwave's software is custom-built to operate our guided wave inspection technologies and is designed to provide advanced functionality in an easy-to-use package.

Hardware
HARDWARE
Guidedwave offers specialized phased array, single-channel/multiplexed, and handheld scanning hardware platforms specifically designed to operate our guided wave probes.

Information technology is a dynamic force, vital to your agency's life  and critical to achieving your mission. Building and running a reliable IT infrastructure, however, is a complicated, multilayered endeavor, requiring a variety of services covering every stage of the IT lifecycle.

UNICOM Government's Implementation Services bring you a powerful means of delivering a successful solution every time.

Our seasoned and certified professionals apply industry-leading practices to ensure that your project proceeds as planned,
while continually focusing on what's most important to you  meeting your mission objectives.
 

 
The Value of Program Management
Such meticulous attention ensures all programs and related task orders proceed efficiently, with minimal risks and optimized business results.  
UNICOM Government's Program Management Office provides the strategic direction, oversight, and leadership that is necessary to manage large, complex, and mission-critical programs. We apply technology lifecycle methodology, using performance-based management principles, to deliver enterprise level solutions and services to our government customers. This is accomplished by combining industry-leading technology products and Commercial Off-the-Shelf (COTS) software, with world-class service delivery and innovative business practices to programmatically improve the acquisition, deployment, and operation of IT infrastructure.

Our highly-experienced program management team provides the oversight and leadership critical to our customers' successdefining and prioritizing goals, establishing reporting processes, and managing across departments and business entities.

 

Through continuous communication, collaboration, and milestone management, our professionals make sure stakeholders are informed and technical teams remain focused, to ensure your projects are delivered on time, on budget, and within scope.  
The Discipline of Project Management
UNICOM Government's certified and experienced Project Management Professionals work hand-in-hand with our Program Management Office to effectively manage the scope, cost, and scheduling of your project - meeting timelines, budget, and planning requirements while assuring quality through risk mitigation and detailed documentation. Our comprehensive process considers every stage of your project, from kickoff to closeout.

Our project managers apply principles from the Project Management Book of Knowledge (PMBOK) and Agile / Scrum principals and processes to provide exceptional oversight and management for project implementations. For large-scale implementations, our team uses the power of an Earned Value Management (EVM) system that employs proven, repeatable processes to guide projects to successful completion. Resources and logistics are managed throughout the project, using a single, integrated methodology that incorporates scheduling and cost metrics that enables early identification of issues before they have a chance to jeopardize project success.

 

 

The Highest Level of Engineering Expertise
Whether your needs are in the network, server/storage, software, cloud, or security arena, our talented teams draw on their considerable expertise to ensure your project's success. 
UNICOM Government's engineering staff offers years of industry experience in developing and integrating state-of-the-art technology. Our highly skilled experts are proficient across a wide range of disciplines, allowing us to tackle challenges in a variety of areas and concerns. Our seasoned engineers hold many industry certifications and specializations, along with the security clearances required by our government customers - all the qualifications needed to plan, design, implement, and operate essential infrastructures that satisfy today's rigorous business demands, and provide the foundation for meeting tomorrow's needs.

Our experience extends from the network to the end user, encompassing the cloud, data center, field offices, inter-networked campuses, communication closets, and distribution frames, as well as critical infrastructure environments such as public works, seaports, airports, and research facilities.

Our engineers deliver high levels of customer service while providing the best solution possible for your organization and constituency needs. From initial site surveys and assessments to infrastructure design and implementation, our IT professionals use proven methodologies, tools, and metrics to optimize performance and accommodate future enhancements.

A precise mix of engineering, integration, and logistical support for complex turnkey systems.

Our certified engineers have proven experience in industry leading integration platforms. UNICOM Government's knowledge of government IT requirements, coupled with strong integration and asset management experience, help mitigate project risks when integrating new technologies in our customers' environments.

Our secure, 49,000-square-foot center operates 24-hours a day and holds more than 1,340 build stations, allowing for up to 2,500 builds per day. A project manager oversees logistics support and fulfillment of services for each project, to streamline deployment, reduce downtime, manage costs, and consolidate resources.

Additionally, UNICOM Government provides a range of asset tracking and inventory management services, incorporating such tools as radio frequency identification (RFID), that enable you to track assets from the time of purchase to end of life.

Our asset management services help reduce the costs and resources devoted to inventory management and reconciliation, and assist in preventing duplicate expenditures on existing technology. To meet security and environmental concerns, our end-of-life services meet the strictest regulations for degaussing, disposing, and disposition of obsolete equipment.

Our Integration Center, located in the Washington, D.C., metropolitan area, is an ISO 9001:2015 certified facility where dedicated professionals assemble, integrate, test, and configure systems to your specifications.

THE ASSURANCE OF SUPPORT AND
MAINTENANCE SERVICES
A comprehensive portfolio of renewable support designed to
keep your environment up and running

Let UNICOM Government provide a single point of contact for all your support services needs. Continuing problems can arise from having to deal with dozens, if not hundreds of different support contracts, with just as many expiration dates, service providers, and levels of support. Pinpointing who is accountable for supporting each device, under what coverage, can be difficult and frustrating.
With UNICOM Government Support and Maintenance Services, you can save time and resources by accessing your consolidated support contract information through our First Call Help Desk and through our 24/7 web portal, at your convenience. We provide you with the efficient tools to decrease downtime and expense, allowing you to stay focused on your mission.

SupportNet
UNICOM Government's SupportNet is a web-enabled service that gives you live access to comprehensive warranty and maintenance service information in a single database.

SupportNet enables you to:

View multi-vendor inventory in a single data management tool
Proactively manage, aggregate, and co-terminate support contracts
Receive auto renewal and expiration alerts
Obtain customized reporting for gap assessments

To learn more about the benefits of SupportNet, visit the SupportNet Page.

Our proven solution focuses on consolidating support contracts, co-terminating where possible, identifying the proper level of support for each component  and maintaining the information all in one place. Our proactive approach extends the life of your IT assets, and promotes and maintains the technological efficiencies and performance of your infrastructure.

FINANCIAL SERVICES THAT
MAXIMIZE YOUR BUDGET
Procurement strategies to accelerate the deployment of technology and enable organizations to structure payments over time.

UNICOM Government's financing options help organizations move technology asset and service costs away from capital budgets to operating and maintenance budgets. This shields your IT programs and projects from funding cuts and eliminates peaks in capital expenditures. In addition, pay-for-use and leasing options enable customers to align predictable payments with business objectives and show proof of performance throughout the lifecycle of the solution.

Using a value-based service model, UNICOM Government Financial Services helps you restructure your IT expenses so they are predictable and manageable. As a result, you:

Reduce large initial cash and resource outlays
Drive projects to completion faster
Obtain the best and most relevant technology and services, when they are needed
Build in refresh cycles so technology remains current
Eliminate the responsibility of ownership
Reduce total cost of ownership
Retain a single source for IT assets, services, and financing
Financing options include:

Lease to Own Plan (LTOP) - The most basic level of financing technology assets; the contracting agency or department takes ownership of the assets at the end of the lease term
Lease with Option to Own (LWOO) - The option to own the assets at the end of the lease term or to apply funds towards new technology and continue financing the equipment
LWOO with Refresh - The benefits of LWOO plus the option to cycle new technology throughout the term of the agreement
IT as a Service - A value-based offering ideal for performance-based contracts that provides a technology lifecycle management approach using a services contract
UNICOM Government Financial Services provides the guidance that helps you identify the best avenue for procuring your technology assets while following federal laws, regulations, and guidelines.

THE POWER OF SUPPORTNET
Providing agencies a fast and easy means of viewing multi-vendor product and support service data all within a single, secure web portal.

With its user-friendly interface  and vendor neutral design  SupportNet gives agencies instant access to critical information, including customer purchase order numbers, serial numbers, product part numbers, warranty expiration dates, service levels, end-of-service dates and more.

Comprehensive information provided by SupportNet allows agencies to quickly view and evaluate the products and support services they have and what service levels an agency is entitled to receive. SupportNet will also reveal items that were purchased, but not covered by an additional support service.

With SupportNet, agencies have the benefit of:

Dedicated service manager who will help oversee and ensure accuracy of data within SupportNet and, where applicable, within OEM systems
Ability to proactively manage, aggregate and co-terminate support contracts
Receipt of automated renewal notices alerting of upcoming support expirations
Submit service change and support requests via a case management feature, making it easy to adjust contract information
Ability to run and export reports to assess state of assets and gain visibility into service availability and any coverage gaps
To learn more about UNICOM Government's support and maintenance services, please click here. To contact a representative, call 800-999-4874 or click below to email us.

Click here to email SupportNet
With UNICOM Government SupportNet, agencies are well equipped to make better decisions about the support needed, decrease downtime and increase productivity, reduce lapse-of-coverage incidents and lower acquisition and administrative costs, and ultimately, improve the return on investment for their IT infrastructure.

Business Name: Stiles Truck Body And Equipment, Inc.
Text:
Welcome to Stiles Truck Body & Equipment, Inc. We are proud to be a well-established family business located here in the heart of the Central Valley, since September of 1984. Our firm has grown to become a well-respected leader in our industry; supplying premium quality truck equipment to many customers throughout the Western United States.

 

Our Mission, Our Quality, Our Workmanship:

Stiles Truck Body was founded and built on our steadfast commitment to providing our wide and varied clientele with the absolute best in top quality workmanship, coupled with unequaled service; All delivered at competitive prices which have enabled us to develop and maintain many long-standing business relationships with our customers over many years.

 

Service is Paramount:

We are proud to be a medium size, family operated organization. We have built our business and well-earned reputation by providing direct personalized one on one service. We exist to serve YOU, the customer. Top notch service is paramount to our business! Please call us at 209.667.2639 anytime to discuss your specific needs directly with one of our knowledgeable staff of experienced professionals. We look forward to your call!

Quality Versus Quantity:

Unlike many of the larger truck equipment companies that have dismissed quality and service to focus on increased sales volumes by selling mediocre products off the shelf with minimal customer interaction or service, Stiles Truck Body & Equipment maintains the belief and practice that by providing the best quality products and service available, increased sales volume will take care of itself. We are committed to that business model which has been the foundation of our continued growth and success over the past 30+ years.

Experienced Craftsmen. Seasoned Professionals.

We employ approximately nine highly skilled craftsmen, experienced installers, and talented  fabricators in our production shop, along with a team of caring sales staff and knowledgeable parts department personnel. At Stiles Truck Body & Equipment we are particularly proud of our state of the art body and paint department with the capacity to facilitate any size vehicle.

Our Heritage. Our Future.

After 35+ years in business, Stiles Truck Body continues to set the standard for truck equipment in Central California. Our long-standing and continuing practice to embrace and integrate the latest manufacturing technologies allows us to remain optimally efficient and be well-positioned to expand our business well into the future. We look forward to serving our customers by providing installing, maintaining, or upgrading the highest quality truck equipment available.

Entertainment

We supply short- and long-term general equipment rental, as well as high-reach equipment rental and services for the event and entertainment industries.

Conventions & Trade Shows
Build booths and manage shows easily with equipment designed to last from setup to teardown. Choose from reliable machines to specialized equipment made to work in and around trade show and convention venues.

Events & Festivals
Bring experiences to life with a full range of products for organizing events and festivals of all sizes. From music to merchandise, Ahern Entertainment offers general equipment and high-reach equipment to liven up any stage.

Concerts

TV & Movie Production
Get in on the action with equipment that works anywhere on set. Fully functioning props perform well in front of the camera. Machines can be blacked out with removable black paint for minimal visibility behind the scenes.

Nationwide Services & Pricing
A national network of equipment and services offers convenience, consistency and full coverage anywhere in the U.S.

Standardized national pricing fits your budget and saves you money. Regardless of location, enjoy access to an entire fleet of equipment, on-time delivery and fast service response.

A national service network of highly qualified technicians is always on hand for any equipment repair and maintenance. Available fueling services keep your projects running at top speed without interruptions.


Crane
Complete jobs quickly and efficiently with versatile cranes and crane products that maximize productivity and drive projects forward.
Regions served: Services across 35 states

Ahern Rentals Specialty Division - Crane Solutions
LIFT AND GO with our line of telescopic truck-mounted cranes and crane products.
Versatile, trustworthy and efficient, these models are engineered to provide safe and effective loading of cargo. The high-quality materials and manufacturing will endure even the heaviest lifts and weather conditions.

Ahern Rentals Boom trucks
Boom trucks
Great for lifting materials, boom trucks are highly maneuverable on the jobsite. Typical applications include signage installation, oil and gas, HVAC maintenance, truss work, pipeline, utilities, lighting and natural disaster cleanup.

Manitex 1770C
Manitex 2892C

Carry deck
Highly versatile carry deck cranes are compact with a rotating boom for hoisting large amounts of materials or transporting directly on the deck. Common uses include in oil fields, maintenance, refineries, mills, construction and natural disaster cleanup.

Broderson IC-80
Broderson IC-200
Ahern Rentals Glass Manipulator
Glass manipulators
For maximum control and precision, glass manipulators have the ability to install glass panels at many angles. These detail-oriented machines can securely lift, transport and hold pieces of glass of any shape, regardless of weight distribution.

Jekko MR800
SmartLift SL408
SmartLift SL608
SmartLift SL1008
Ahern Rentals Mini cranes
Mini cranes
Mini crawler cranes have a compact body and small tailswing for working in confined spaces. These highly flexible cranes are convenient to transport with slim designs that also fit through standard doorways.

Jekko SPX309
Jekko SPX312C+
Jekko SPX429C+
Jekko SPX527
Ahern Rentals Minipicker
Minipicker
Unique to the mini crane category, minipickers provide a compact and lightweight mini telescopic crane that is designed for use on hard surfaces and can navigate tight areas to move heavy and awkward items.

Jekko MPK20
Ahern Rentals Roto Telescopic Handler
Roto telescopic handler
The Roto telescopic handler is a multi-use piece of equipment that is more advanced than a forklift with greater extension ability.

Merlo Roto 50.35 S Plus

Trench Safety
Protect your crew and your bottom line with durable, quality trench safety rental products. Ahern Rentals Trench Safety carries an array of equipment to create a safe working environment on excavation, trenching and underground utility projects.
Regions served: Southern California, Southern Nevada, Southern Utah, Northwest Arizona

Ahern Rentals Specialty Division - Trench Safety Solutions
Trench Shields
Ahern Rentals Trench Shields
Trench Shields
4" & 6"
Designed with narrow sidewalls, these lightweight trench shields are the industry standard workhorse that deliver rugged performance and reduce labor time with good depth ratings. Ideal for use with 30,000-80,000 lbs. excavators.

Ahern Rentals Slide Rail
Slide Rail
This slide rail is a highly versatile vertical sheeting and trench support system. Its modular design can be used with side panel lining plates or in-line sheeting templates to provide underground trench support where ground conditions or infrastructure prove problematic.

Ahern Rentals Steel Frame Aluminum Trench Shield
Steel Frame Aluminum Trench Shield
Engineered to offer the protection and security of steel trench boxes at less than half the weight. Steel frame aluminum trench shields are strong enough to keep workers safe yet lightweight for easy transportation and assembly, making them ideal for smaller jobs and in place of steel trench boxes.

Ahern Rentals Hydraulic Trench Shield
Hydraulic Trench Shield
Ideal for irregular size excavations, this uniquely designed manifold of hydraulic trench shields allows precise control of fluid to each cylinder while safely outside the trench. With hydraulic and static options, the hydraulic trench shield can apply full pressure on the sides in hydraulic mode, or work like a standard trench box in static mode.

Shoring
Ahern Rentals Vertical Aluminum Hydraulic Shores
Vertical Aluminum Hydraulic Shores
To prevent cave-ins under the most unstable soil conditions, vertical aluminum hydraulic shores apply hydraulic pressure to support the side walls of the trench. This safe and simple shoring solution is quick and easy to install and remove from the top of the trench.

Ahern Rentals Aluminum Red Shores
Aluminum Red Shores
Corrugated aluminum hydraulic end shores are ideal for adding third-sided protection to a trench when working next to buildings or existing structures. The specialized hydraulic shores utilize hydraulic telescoping steel-enclosed cylinders as spreaders.

Ahern Rentals Trench Plates
Trench Plates
Steel trench plates are made with diamond-shaped welds to create a secure, skid-resistant surface that meet local regulations and increase jobsite safety.

Heavy-duty trench plates offer versatility on construction sites to preserve flooring while moving large or heavy equipment; to provide a secure surface in areas that are wet, soft or saturated; or to protect infrastructure and other objects during demolition projects.

All standard sizes are 1 in. thick. Special sizes available upon request.

4 ft. x 8 ft.
5 ft. x 10 ft.
6 ft. x 8 ft.
6 ft. x 10 ft.
6 ft. x 12 ft.
8 ft. x 10 ft.
8 ft. x 12 ft.
8 ft. x 16 ft.
8 ft. x 20 ft.
Confined-Space Equipment

Aluminum Telescoping Tripod
In confined-space entry and rescue situations, your equipment must operate quickly and efficiently. Our full line of high-quality, rugged confined-space rescue equipment and confined-space retrieval
systems meet a variety of safety needs. Plus, we offer customized solutions for spaces of varying size, shape, orientation and location.

Electric Ventilation Blower
High-velocity, portable axial fan blowers provide adequate ventilation in confined workspaces. Our 8-inch axial blower with canister is equipped with 25 feet of ducting.

This lightweight unit is designed with a quick-connect clipping system to easily attach the canister with no tools required. Use input for powerful extraction or output for ventilation when working in confined spaces.

Gas Ventilation Blower
Without using an electric power source, our gas ventilation blower exhausts ventilation for a safe confined workspace. For versatility and power, our ripcord ventilator is designed for maximum performance.

Place the ripcord ventilator onto an open manhole to clear the hazardous atmosphere from confined spaces. The gas ventilator pulls the air and discharges dangerous gases for a safer and cleaner work environment.


Gas Monitors
Portable gas monitors detect combustible, flammable and toxic gases, as well as oxygen depletion in a confined workspace. Identifying potential toxic or explosive gases can reduce the risk of injury, illness or death.


Test Plugs
To test for leaks and pressure levels in pipes, our multi-size back and front pipe plugs can expand to fit for better control of flow. Made with high-quality materials, our line of pipe plugs is 50% lighter and substantially more flexible than other brands.

Site Support
Ahern Rentals Sifter Box
Sifter Box
Sifter boxes separate large stones and other debris from existing backfill material. Screens are constructed of heavy-duty vertically placed bars and are available in 1, 3, 4 and 6 in. widths.

Ahern Rentals Deflection Gauge
Deflection Gauge
For fast, quality testing of new underground pipeline installations, our deflection gauges are available for any size pipe. Rugged construction can stand up to multiple uses.

Ahern Rentals Bedding Box
Bedding Box
Bedding boxes eliminate the waste of excess bedding material while maximizing equipment efficiency at the jobsite. This heavy-duty box is strengthened by an inner core of hardwood on the top frame. Built extra tough, clean sweep ends and corners are reinforced to meet the needs of construction sites.

Ahern Rentals Track Out Grid
Track Out Grid
Shake off loose debris lodged in your truck tires before leaving the jobsite. Place the angular Track Out Grid on the haul road before entering paved streets to shake, flex and dislodge loose mud, dirt, stones and rocks from the treads.

Digital Fault Recorder
The Digital Fault Recorder (DFR) function of the USI DME systems provides our customers with the ability to analyze system protection operations and circuit breaker performance. USI DRFs record instantaneous values (waveforms) of current and voltages, which are sampled many times per cycle, for time periods on the order of a second. May also record computed quantities

Overall, the purpose of a DFR includes recording power system events (voltage & current magnitudes), capturing the exact time at which a fault occurred, power swings, and abnormal instruments transformer behavior, such as CT saturation, DC offset (inductance of the system), and CCVT response. Additionally, a DFR monitors the protection systems performance and checks the power system for failures of a relay to operate as intended (retrofit, trip test switch open, etc.), incorrect tripping of terminals for external faults, determining the optimum line reclose delay, and failure of fault interrupting devices.

Sequence of Events Recorder (SER)?
The Sequence of Events Recorder (SER) function can be found in both USI DME systems and standalone USI SER systems. The SER function monitors external inputs and records status changes that occur in the power system. To accomplish this function the SER samples and time stamps operational data in the chronological sequence in which the events take place. This operational data is monitored from substation equipment (i.e., relays, circuit breakers, etc.) and control schemes (automatic and manual) as they react to an event that takes place within the power systems the SER is monitoring. When collected, this data, which can be caused by several different individual events such as a switching operation, mis-operation, or fault, allows the chain of events to be analyzed and studied when searching for the cause of an event that took place within the power systems, as well as the linkages between individual actions and effects.

Our Company Mission
Backed by superior customer support and product expertise, Sun-Net is able to provide a practical way for your company to increase productivity and reduce overhead. Our experience and knowledge of the electric power and gas industry offers unparalleled product development customized to fit your needs.


iTOA Suite
iTOA (integrated Tools for Operations Application) represents the next generation version of TOA. iTOA includes all the functions of TOA above and is build using HTML5 web platform for new innovative features. It has been engineered for OT-IT (Operations and Information Technology) convergence as well as multi-device/mobile scenarios in the utility industry.

Challenge Utilities Face
We built iTOA to help you not only eliminate these challenges but  help make your staff happier

R
Multiple Data Sources
You have a logging system, an access database, excel sheets, word documents, everything in different places and nowhere to consolidate.

R
Incorrectly Entered or Illegible Data
Verifying, retrieving, searching, and emailing back and forth to correct incorrect entries with no single source of reference. 

R
Archaic In-House Built System
Its hard to maintain an in-house built software and eventually, when workforce changes, theres no one to manage the application or it becomes expensive to support it. 

R
Reinventing the Wheel
Many utilities face the same challenges. With building ones own system, you dont learn how efficiencies can be gained and how other utilities are dealing with the same problems.

R
Manual Entry and Manual Reporting
Time wasted updating multiple data sources, searching for the right data to manually put into Compliance and Management reports. 

R
Increased Risk of Human Error
Its hard to get an overview of the work happening and with so many manual entries, its easy to miss something.

R
Lack of Transparency
No system to log into from anywhere, and relying on email and phone to track work to be performed.

R
Retiring Workforce
Need to streamline processes and workflow as most of the manual processes are kept in peoples heads. Training becomes an issue, and the company is always looking for more efficient methods.

Benefits of iTOA
iTOA streamlines and simplifies your overall System Control processes, reducing redundancy and duplication, saving your company valuable time and money.

R
Integrated Audit Trail System
Timestamp and date for actions and changes made in the system thats auditable and easy to find the person who made a change. 

R
Access iTOA Everywhere
iTOA is a web-enabled application allowing users to access iTOA from any location equipped with network access in a safe and secure manner, across devices.

R
Reduce Human Error and Double Entry
Automate tasks by having inter-linkage, set submission rules, and have set validations in the system.

R
Flexible and Fast Reporting and Querying
Fast reporting, querying capabilities, send out reports directly from the system. Automate redundant tasks and set up auto-run reports for metrics and visual dashboards. 

R
Easy Maintenance and Application Support
Web-based and easy maintenance. We provide long-term support and show you best practices from other utilities and how they manage challenges. Upgrades and adding enhancements is accomplished seamlessly when updates are rolled out. 

R
System of Record
iTOA, which is integrated to many other systems, become the System of Record and you have one true centralized data repository and view, enabling transparency across the entire organization.

RevCom for Policies and Procedures
Why RevCom?

RevComs parallel review process allows expert reviewers and approvers within different offices and at various sites to work on the same policy or procedure simultaneously and privately, supporting a quicker review while maintaining tight version controls.

RevCom enables large-scale reviews in which all of the relevant comments, edits, clearances, and approvals are returned quickly in a single, integrated document.

The collaborative review process allows the expert reviewers in a group to freely discuss the relative merits of a draft within the group, and their comments will remain private until the results of their review are approved for release and posted by the coordinator for the group, at which time they become visible to all of the other reviewing groups.

RevCom controls the process and schedule for draft development, review, and approval.

RevCom for Standards
Go beyond basic balloting and markup

RevCom allows you to work your draft standards easily with the people who are responsible for getting the job doneso that the published standards actually work.

RevComs parallel, collaborative review process allows different organizations to work on the same document at the same time, for a broader review in a shorter period of time.

Keeping pace with standards development in a globalized world

Advances in global communications demand rapid development of critical industry standards. This substantially increases the burden on subject matter experts and reviewers.
RevCom facilitates the updating of a single standard  or an entire set of standards.
Without RevComs capabilities, large-scale coordination of new and revised standards is a slow and tedious process.

RevCom for Regulations and Rulemaking
Improving the regulatory document review and clearance process

With RevCom, you can count on a successful rulemaking process which holds its management and staff accountable to interim and final deadlines.

Quick and controlled

RevCom supports a quicker review while maintaining tight version controls for all of the documents on the rule-making docket. Different reviewers can examine the proposed rule-making concurrently, rather than sequentially, throughout the rule-making process.

RevCom allows reviewers within different offices and across agency boundaries to work on the same rule-making docket simultaneously and privately, supporting a quicker review while maintaining tight version controls for all of the documents on the docket.

RevCom enables large-scale reviews in which all of the relevant comments, edits, clearances, and approvals are returned quickly and embedded where they belong within individual documents.

Accountable to deadlines

A successful rule-making process holds management and staff accountable to interim and final deadlines.

Substantive vs. Editorial reviews

When forced to use a word processor to review draft notices and regulations, reviewers often spend too much time making unnecessary editorial corrections and not enough time focusing their efforts on substantive legal and policy issues. RevCom makes it easy for reviewers and approvers to ask questions, suggest changes, and point out inconsistencies without having to actually edit or re-write the document.

Although RevCom reviewers work directly online in real-time, their work can be seen only within their own groups or offices until the results of the review are posted. This allows the reviewers to collaborate privately until they are ready to submit their final review package for the rest of the department to see.

A BETTER WAY TO BUILD
Dynamic Systems, Inc. (DSI), a national turnkey mechanical and process construction firm, is committed to being an industry leader. We offer preconstruction and construction services that deliver superior design, efficiency and value to our customers across an entire spectrum of industries and systems. To date, weve completed more than 4,000 projects, delivering superior user experience and bottom line performance.

Office buildings that have cleaner air. Airport terminals that have reduced noise and emissions. Hospitals that provide optimum patient comfort. Laboratories that are the safest for technicians. And central utility plants with cooling and heating systems performing double duty saving energy and costs. Thats a better way to build.

Specializing in Diverse Markets and Systems
Commercial & Specialty

For almost 30 years, DSI has been a leader in creating healthy and energy-efficient environments for Commercial & Specialty markets, including:

Airport terminals
Corporate offices/campuses
University/college campuses
Correctional facilities
Solar manufacturing
Challenges include high occupant densities, proximity to food services and environmental noise pollution. Our strategies incorporate energy-efficient and quiet underfloor air delivery and displacement air concepts that radically improve the environment. These strategies include CO2 monitoring, pressurization control and maintaining critical outside air delivery to deliver healthy environments in every building we construct.


For almost three decades, DSI has created forward-thinking, efficient environments for the higher education market. Projects have included university and college academic buildings, professional schools (veterinary and medical), libraries, laboratories and operations facilities.

DSIs scope includes HVAC, mechanical, sheet metal, plumbing and equipment start-up, in many cases without impacting or disrupting ongoing classes. Some of these have achieved a LEED-Gold rating.


Managing successful healthcare projects is a complex process, requiring managers and teams with proven experience and detailed knowledge of specialized design and construction principles. DSI offers comprehensive resources and industry expertise to meet a full range of healthcare needs.

We have completed more than $1 billion in healthcare projects, ranging from new medical centers and research facilities to building renovations. These include ambulatory and specialty care centers, (clean room and BSL standards), blood and chemistry labs and medical office buildings. We bring specialization in:

Medical gas systems
Surgical environments
Imaging facilities
Critical system infrastructure
Installed by skilled technical staff, these systems are delivered precisely commissioned to assure flawless operation. We are proud to contribute to the healthcare industry and to know the projects weve completed will serve patients and families for years to come.

DSI has worked on award-winning hospitality projects, offering customized preconstruction and construction services to our clients. Whether a new flagship hotel, casino or water park, we will prove the best value for your project. Plus, deliver exceptional quality.

Laboratory infrastructure relies heavily on extensive mechanical HVAC and plumbing systems, contain fume hoods, toxic and hazardous chemicals, cleanrooms, waste neutralization, lab gases and ultrapure water. Integrating these systems relies heavily on fully coordinating the BIM model. We have significant 3D design capabilities that allow us to develop a fully coordinated facility.

Considerations for safety include toxic and flammable chemicals. We deliver high-quality installations, fully understanding the safety of the lab technicians is paramount.

Large energy consuming outside and exhaust air systems are required to properly ventilate the spaces. We emphasize design solutions for energy reclamation to reduce this consumption.?Ventilation rates can also be optimized through monitoring of airborne contaminants. Collaboration with contaminant monitoring systems that interface with the HVAC controls can further reduce energy consumption.

Biopharmaceutical manufacturing facilities are extremely complex and exacting. Our team has extensive experience in the fabrication and installation of hygienic piping systems and process equipment for FDA- regulated facilities. Additionally, we provide accurate QA/QC documentation for project turnover packages assuring complete compliance for your IQ and OQ protocols.

To meet the challenges of these rigorous standards, we take a collaborative team approach that involves professionals from each discipline in every stage of the project. This approach enables us to closely manage the complete project scope from preconstruction planning and design to restoration and turnover.

The microelectronic industry is a significant component of our diverse construction experience. Much of our history is based on the construction of these exacting facilities. DSI has been extremely successful on these projects that require on-time delivery at a relentless pace and an exceptional quality level.

The systems we commonly install in microelectronic facilities include:

Toxic gas delivery
Scrubbed acid exhaust
Ultrapure DI water
Cleanroom HVAC
Acid neutralization facilities
Process cooling water
Solvent waste systems
Bulk gas delivery
Bulk chemical delivery
Cryogenic gas delivery

The focus of Mission Critical Facilities design and construction is protecting and sustaining clients vital intellectual property and sustaining operations. DSIs quality and reliability deliver the functionality to ensure uninterrupted 24/7 operation. High quality and timely construction are requirements  not goals.

The virtually constant high-cooling loads in these facilities present energy-saving opportunities we adeptly use to your advantage. Large thermal storage tanks allow chilled water production during off peak hours. Lower energy costs during these hours save cost and create efficiency in power plant operations.

Chiller optimization control solutions determine the best operating conditions after assessing operation variables. The most efficiently tuned chiller plants benefit from a complete understanding of these variables during commissioning.

Golden Svcs provides a comprehensive range of cyber security services to identify and mitigate risk in your information infrastructure from cyber-attack and environmental disasters. These services include the complete life cycle from risk analysis, developing a secure architecture, developing an integrated cyber security software suite, policy and procedure development, implementation, monitoring, and compliance testing. Dr. Stephen Batsell leads the Golden Svcs team and is a renowned subject matter expert with over 30 years experience in cyber security, information assurance, and related topics. 

CYBERSECURITY SERVICES
